Author: 1 September 2020
Review: One Of The Best Inspirational Movie Ever
Review_Url: This movie was so boring. My friend and I had a marker fight in the back of the theater, we were so bored. Usually, I love anything Robin Williams is in. While I liked his performance, the rest of the actors and the movie, by definition blew. The plot was slow, the character development was slow. Everything was slow and boring. I am so glad I didn't pay for it, because I would have demanded my money back. I cant remember the last time I ever wasted two hours. I only went because I had a free pass. I am infinitely glad that Damon and Affleck haven't written anything so rampantly horrible since. One good thing about it was, that it cant get much worse than that, and their future attempts can only get better, cant they?

Author: 24 May 2005
Review_Url: I haven't met a single person that hasn't heard of this movie and it took me way to long to sit down and watch it but im so glad i finally did. I still miss you Robin Williams, you beautiful man.

Author: 2 February 2022
Review: That SOB almost made me tear up
Review_Url: "Good Will Hunting" is a must-see movie for anyone who loves a good drama with a heartwarming message. Starring Matt Damon and the late Robin Williams, the film tells the story of Will Hunting, a janitor at MIT who possesses an extraordinary gift for mathematics.

Author: 9 May 2023
Review: "Good Will Hunting": A Classic Tale of Brilliance, Growth, and Friendship
Review_Url: "Good Will Hunting" is a 1997 drama directed by Gus Van Sant starring Matt Damon and Robin Williams. Certain films you watch will have an indescribable impact on you. Period. That is the short but indisputable truth, and I dare to claim that every single movie loving cinephile has at least one title that has changed their life forever and will always be in their heart as such. As I have expressed often enough, such films as "Donnie Darko" and "Dead Poets Society" have had this exact effect on me, but there are also some titles that mean the same to me (or even more) but I don't give enough credit for. This happens to be the case with this magnificent drama. My affection for it dates back to roughly two years ago when I watched it during a personally shaping phase, the summer after graduating from high school and before starting my new job, a short but significant period. Boy, during this time I made some precious memories, and one of them was the first time watch of that very movie. As I was today, I have been blown away by the pure ingeniousness that underlies everything in this production, and it also afterwards has drawn my attention to another certain Robin Williams film that changed my life for the better (Hint: Carpe Diem!). As you can probably guess from the way I formulated the previous sentences, this isn't the only aspect about it that makes it so special for me, because later on I met someone special who changed my life forever as well and whose favourite film of all time happens to be exactly this one. Yes, this film has several connotations to me and thus it is one I will never get tired of. Even though the situation has changed drastically since then and I am no longer in touch with this indeed special person, I thought I'd commemorate her and the past we shared by watching her favourite movie of all time on what happens to be her birthday. I think by now it is obvious that this is without a doubt the most personal review I've ever composed, but what to expect from a passion that bases its existence on the purest of emotions? Watching movies is never a thing of neutrality or detachment, feelings are always in play and I'd be lying to deny that and, in this case, not to mention at least once that it is also a personal issue. All sentimentality and personal attachments put aside, it is still outstanding as a cinematic achievement, nevertheless. To this day, it utterly amazes me to know that the film's basic idea and script were part of a playwriting class that Damon took. Not only is it totally inspiring, but also another proof that even the smallest ideas can make it to the big screen, in this case by the help of his best friend and co-star Ben Affleck, as well as Kevin Smith. There's barely a negative thing I could say about this film, as it is indeed perfect to me. With it, the screenwriter duo cemented their place in Hollywood and became famous, and for a reason. In their opus magnum, they combine everything a first-class drama needs and does all of that in the most professional manner possible. To be honest, I currently cannot come up with a screenplay more original and ingenious then this one. The major reason for this film's huge success is without a doubt the way everything is worded. Not only is it infinitely authentic, the lines are all extraordinarily intelligent to the very last one. Every dialogue delivered isn't only intellectual but also incredibly powerful and fascinating. I can't even decide which sequence is my favourite. They are all so brilliant. The scene Will lambastes that guy in the bar after he has made his best friend look stupid? Jaw-dropping. The sequence when Sean lectures his client about true love? Made my flesh crawl! The "It is not your fault" part? I cried like a baby! And those are only the most outstanding of them all, the fascination is an endless aspect in this matter. Mainly, because the film isn't only a conflation of a few dramatic acts, it is much more. I absolutely adore how this film depicts that intelligence isn't a matter of financing, but giftedness and devotion. Titular protagonist Will Hunting is only a wastrel from South Boston for most people, and the neighbourhood he lives in and the friends he meets with validate this impression on first sight, but beneath all this a genius, an uncut diamond lies dormant. From maths to medicine, over law and economics there is not a single thing he didn't teach himself via books, and the fact that he is the only one who solves a mathematical equation (twice!) only proves again that intellect is a matter of dedication and diligence. Despite everything he knows in theory, there is still much he doesn't understand, and that's where the dramatic aspect comes into the picture. As a result of his upbringing in poor circumstances, he was only able to acquire booklore and simply lacks the knowledge of experience. This is were the old conflict of upper class vs. underclass shows to advantage. Deep inside, he is a boy genius with an enormous potential who has everything it takes to be someone who will change the world, but the underprivileged conditions he was raised on made him the problematic boy he is. He is reckless, at times cantankerous, uncouth, cocky and most importantly, not aware of his own capabilities. This young man is the product an unusual environment, exactly what happens when two worlds collide, but he doesn't belong to any of them. He needs someone who guides his way and that's where Professor Lambeau and Sean Maguire come into play. While the first helps him realize his talent in a more practical, more work-orientated way, the latter shows him how to deal with his live in in its most minimal facets. The most fascinating aspects about those two mentors is how they teach him the most important things, but also still learn a lot from him as well. Thus, each and every character develops in a wonderful manner and isn't the same they used to be in the beginning. During the therapy lessons with Sean, he is gradually taught how to deal with the things one cannot learn from books, such as love and relationships. This comes in handy when Will gets to know his British girlfriend Skylar he experiences those totally new things with. Simultaneously, we also learn more about his troubled past and how he has experienced physical abuse. All this makes his eclectic character perfectly realistic, lifelike and likeable despite his imperfections. Like with every other remarkable drama, all of this would be in vein without stellar performances. Next to Skarsgard and Affleck (of which latter was known as the dumb friend of Will Hunting for a long time after) who both shine in their small but important supporting roles, also Minnie Driver convinces with her mainly minimalistic but not less brilliant acting, but the without a doubt most outstanding performances are delivered by Damon and Williams. Individually, they already deliver what is justifiably considered as cinematic history and show their versatility and enormous acting range, but together they are even more excellent and a true powerhouse of dramatic acting. They start out as incongruous individuals but form an unlikely bond and eventually a special friendship. As if the star power and acting ability of the cast wasn't already enough, the film also offers enough technical features that make it even more terrific. Next to the impressing musical score by Danny Elfman, the cinematography coveys the feeling of extreme intimacy and the underlines the vulnerability of its characters, as it mainly consists of closeup shots that enable this effect. All in all, this outstanding drama is by far one of the most original and best conceptualised movies I have ever seen. What started out as a simple homework for a playwriting class, ended up becoming a touching drama that combines great acting with its wonderfully written script. Even if it plays with its tonal directions, and includes scenes of drama, humour, and optimism, it never becomes a mess while doing so and doesn't unnecessarily pull at the viewer's heartstrings. A wonderfully paced and heart-warming film that has it all to be called a perfect masterpiece. I am absolutely in awe of the story, the characters and the film as a cinematic achievement in general. Truly an inspiring piece of art and the proof that the lady I mentioned in the beginning has a phenomenal taste in movies. I am aware that she will never see this review, but having said that: Happy birthday, nevertheless...

Author: 24 June 2020
Review: A masterpiece that personally means so much to me
Review_Url: Even if you took away all the pre Oscar/post Oscar hype, the delightful appeal of the cast (most notably the brother-like chemistry between Ben Afflick and Matt Damon.) You are still left with one heck of a great movie. The plot of the movie is good but the real charm of the movie is the power of the scripts writing.  In fact there is no scene in the movie that isn't great.  Most notably the scenes in which Will Hunting (Matt Damon) is being interviewed by the many shrinks which are supposed to help him. Definitely a must see!

Author: 27 December 1998
Review_Url: I think that the only good thing this movie has is Robin Williams' performance.

Author: 26 December 1998
Review: I CAN'T BELIEVE PEOPLE LIKED IT
Review_Url: If you are crazy about the word *uck, you will love this movie because that is predominantly going to be all that you will hear.  Oh, and the scene with Minnie Driver in the bar giving her blow job joke is Oscar material. Puh-leeze!

Author: 17 March 1999
Review: If I hear the word *uck one more time!
Review_Url: This is just a movie, folks, not a case study.  As interested as I am in literary, historical, and sociological elements of dramatic films, I am put off by psychoanalysis or tortured deconstruction.

Author: 1 September 2003
Review: The Importance of Not Being Too Earnest
Review_Url: This is a pretty good movie for the most part. i like the characters and robin williams was awesome. the only parts i didn't enjoy were the romance scenes. and it's not because the love story was unnecessary like in many movies. it played a function in the story. it just wasn't done very well. there are also some parts i thought were stupid (about 2 viewings, 6/20/2020)

Author: 21 June 2020
Review_Url: Hadnt seen this movie in decades and I remembered it as a somewhat cheesy, sentimental story, how wrong my memory was though, because this movie is without a doubt a blokes movie. Not cheesy at all. But is simultaneously quite touching, uplifting and most of all TRUE to LIFE. Terrific true to life dialogues! Really magnificent.

Author: 16 January 2020
Review: Even if your heart is made out of stone, it will still melt by this terrific coming of age tale. One of kind! Deservedly Oscar winner!
Review_Url: Let's face it: I hated mathematics at school and still do today, so the film didn't appeal to me in that sense, but it appealed to me in respect of life's lessons. I also enjoyed the film due to Robin Williams, whom I just love as an actor. This was a very dramatic and emotional role for him, which he did brilliantly. Matt Damon was also very good and believable as the young rebel. Ben Affleck's character was unnecessary and mostly silly and I found he ruined the scenes where he was present (although the character does give the best advise towards the end). Minnie Driver was also excellent as the love interest Skylar. She really gave a powerful performance.

Author: 27 November 2018
Review: Well made and well acted, but ultimately not my cup of tea.
Review_Url: Apparently this film stirs a wide variety of emotions: from great to sucks. I'm on the lower end.

Author: 4 August 2022
Review_Url: A fantastic mix of drama, humour, brashness, sorrow, trauma, hope and possibilities make Good Will Hunting a very captivating movie.

Author: 10 October 2020
Review_Url: A movie with great actors, yet an even greater message.

Author: 2 January 2015
Review_Url: Normally I hate films with good messages but this one was different and there are different reasons for it. Just let me tell that I couldn't believe my eyes when I noticed this movie was ranked among the 250 best movies ever as that's certainly not the case as it's the kind of movie you have seen before...

Author: 5 April 2004
Review_Url: A South Boston whiz kid elects to clean the halls of learning rather than enter them, slumming his way through life as a janitor at MIT. But his natural ability to unravel complex equations attracts the attention of a professor who won't let him quit, a beautiful Harvard student who wants to save him, a sympathetic buddy who wants him to escape South Boston, and a counselor who encourages him. A soundly acclaimed, homegrown effort from lifelong Boston buddies Damon and Affleck, which granted them the Academy Award for "Best Screenplay".

Author: 20 July 2007
Review_Url: I just loved this film! Excellent screenplay and writing as well as directing.

Author: 11 July 2017
Review_Url: Good Will Hunting has been acclaimed as one of the most inspirational, tear-jerking films of the late 90's. The script is extremely impressive considering that it came from two Hollywood no-names: Matt Damon and Ben Affleck (Well, they were back then anyways).

Author: 24 May 2019
Review: Excellent job from a couple of Hollywood newbies.
Review_Url: While I am not quite as enamored with this film as are many, it is very good. I had never watched it somehow until 2012, although I remembered well the rise of Matt Damon because of this film. And, of course, it was written by Ben Affleck and Damon.

Author: 29 February 2012
Review_Url: I know I'm against the grain on this one, but I truly hated this movie to the point where I almost walked out. I had absolutely no sympathy for the Matt Damon character. He's not mentally ill, rather he's a spoiled brat who needs a slap on the face. He treats everyone badly through his own self centeredness--the point is we are supposed to believe he has changed at the end. Not to give the ending away, but he's as self centered as ever as the movie closes, and that is what I found so annoying about the story. Indeed, everything in this movie was annoying from the downbeat girlfriend to the mawkish Robin Williams, who spouts some of the most embarrassing dialogue I've ever heard. Yes, I cried all five times I saw Titanic, but this left me totally cold!

Author: 6 August 1998
Review_Url: Good Will Hunting came out in 1997 and tells the story of a remarkable young man played by Matt Damon who hangs around with the wrong crowd as he came out of foster. When Will works as a janitor he does a math sum which impresses one of the teachers at the school played by Stellan Skarsgard. But when Will is up for probation after beating a guy in the yard he gets help from a physicatrist played by Robin Williams (who won an Oscar for his portrayal as Sean Maguire) who tries to talk sense with Will. But will he open up.

Author: 5 December 2018
Review: Very good movie starring Robin Williams
Review_Url: Unfortunately, I feel I am in the awkward and depressing position of having to criticize this movie - despite rating it an 8. The reason is because so many people rated it a 9 or 10.

Author: 7 March 1999
Review_Url: Good Will Hunting takes place in Boston, which is where actor Matt Damon and Ben Affleck grew up together. It's not the Boston most people are familiar with, the Boston Common, the Charles River and the famous attractions. Instead, much of action takes place in the grittiness of Southie, or South Boston, shrouded in lower middle class desperation.

Author: 3 July 2016
Review: One of a kind original story
Review_Url: Really touching ! The movie have strong moments and difficult ones . We are talking about a young man who have difficulties in life and reveal to be a very talented guy but have psychological issues about lot of stuff and some Adults try to help him find his way and offer him some jobs and possibilites . I found that really good . Any young men can identify with that situation and the struggle to find his path . I really love how authentic is the movie and it didnt try to make us impress or something but just tell a story of a young man . I really enjoyed it.

Author: 17 June 2022
Review_Url: I went with my wife to see this in the theater. When the plot failed to go anywhere after an hour, we left.

Author: 24 October 2002
Review: HOW did this thing ever make money???
Review_Url: This movie is quite simply amazing. It has a plot that might be known to some: a troubled kid with a lot of potencial, but this movie touches so many important aspects, and does it so well... First of all, it is an absolute delight to see the relationship between Will and Sean develop, it is amazingly well done, totally believable, real... Second of all, the relationship between Will and Skyla: this is one of the best movies in what comes to demonstrating what it is like to be really in love (that initial part when you are absolutely crazy about each other), it happens just like that... Third of all, all the question around what makes a life valuable: an honored job? To be happy? Who's to say? This is what the movie is all about and it develops this question fantastically, with many side stories to it, such as the relationship between Will and his friends and the relationship between the professor and Sean, as well as Will's own life story, which also is very well aborded throughout the movie: a very difficult character to deal with, and they did it brilliantly. Matt Damon was superb, acting as well as writing, Robin Williams was somehow even better, and Ben Affleck made an amazing secundary impact in a hard part. The directors were very well, capturing quite well the love scenes and Will's face towards Skyla, as well as the everlasting tension between Sean and the professor. All, all, all, all so very good. 10/10 because I can't give more. One of the all time greatest movies.

Author: 2 June 2019
Review: One of the all time greatest
Review_Url: Good Will Hunting is a drama movie directed by Gus Van Sant and stars Robin Williams, Matt Damon, Ben Affleck, Stellan Skarsgård, Minnie Driver, Casey Affleck and Cole Hauser.

Author: 11 June 2020
Review_Url: Actually, it's the same plot : a math genius from a poor neighborhood who needs help to have a meaningful life and get out of heavy relatives ! In six seasons of « shameless », we didn't have a resolution while here in two hours, we close the story. The movie has a lot of things that i like : Boston, campus, Danny Elfman, Robin Williams and for sure an extraordinary trio of newcomers with Damon, Affleck and Minnie Driver (at least in an American production)! Actually i didn't put Minnie in my 12 best actresses list but i think i will do it as her English class is unique! She should have won the Oscar because she illuminates a rather transparent part (the serious student girlfriend) with original and personal input ! Robin is good as a humanist shrink but i won't go ahead as i can't really support a movie that supports psychological help : what says Robin can be found in any good philosophical book : life is about experiences, getting to know others and abuse victims aren't culprits. In other way, Affleck says it as good as Robin and without the qualifications: Will has everything to get a life so he must move his ass !

Author: 20 May 2016
Review_Url: It is for sure a great movie, me personally wasn't really 'grapped' by it. I appreciate the strong story line and the strong characters which are exposed gracefully. But personally, the story was for me way too slow, way too obvious and way too much cliche (personally! - the lost boy and the grand 'dad' who mentors him...?).

Author: 21 November 2019
Review: Moving coming of age story - but not for me.
Review_Url: Matt Damon is Will Hunting; an underachieving math prodigy working as a janitor at M.I.T. He is discovered by a professor who, through a series of unusual events, is able to recruit the young genius to work on complex math formulas. Hunting has a severely deprived upbringing, involving foster care and physical abuse. Robin Williams; in his Academy Award winning role, shows up as a sympathetic psychiatrist who is recruited to rescue Will from his many demons. Williams and Damon are excellent, and the script is well written and smart, although it turns a bit too sentimental for my taste at the end of over two hours. Van Zant could have tightened up the editing; noisy bar scenes are always an unnecessary tool; and there are at least one too many in Good Will Hunting. Even with its slight defects, the film is well worth watching.

Author: 17 August 2014
Review_Url: Will Hunting's psychiatrist showed more restraint than I would have. What a smart ass. This was one of the finest films I have seen this year; highly dramatic with flawless performances by all - kept me glued. 5 stars.

Author: 2 October 1999
Review: I woulda thrown Will to the dogs
Review_Url: Perhaps the only thing that's beyond normal in "Good Will Hunting" is the fact that Will Hunting is a mathematical genius. The rest is about as real as a film can get while still being interesting. To be two hours about a young man and his issues and to be so good says a lot about the acting and the writing of this film: that it's very, very good.

Author: 15 March 2008
Review: One of the most deeply and essentially human films ever
Review_Url: Robin Williams should have been the centre of this movie as he struggled to swim upstream against the tide of an emotionally and morally immature story.

Author: 28 September 1998
Review: Great acting swimming against the current of a fairy story
Review_Url: The story of this movie begins with Matt Damon still in Harvard. He wrote the initial script for this movie as a class assignment. Later on he would recruit Ben Affleck to finish the script with him. And thus one of the most well-known films ever made was born.

Author: 28 January 2018
Review: Arrogant genius learns facts about life
Review_Url: Some of the lines were a bit problematic and unnecessary. Despite this, Robin Williams gave a great performance and Matt Damon held his own too.

Author: 1 July 2019
Review_Url: Back in 1997 a small film made the name of two young actors, Matt Damon and Ben Affleck who were so frustrated about their lack of opportunities wrote their own screenplay so they could star in the film, earning them a Oscar win at the same time.

Author: 8 June 2012
Review_Url: This is a movie that I was late to. I know that I watched part of it after graduating from college, but I realized until watching this with Jaime, my wife, I had never seen this all the way through until now. It is one that I knew was popular from the time that it came out. I didn't connect that this was directed by Gus Van Sant. I've seen a handful of his works and he a bit pretentious. That's not to say he isn't talented.

Author: 20 November 2022
Review: Interesting Look at Intelligents and Humanity
Review_Url: This is an intense movie and includes many strong performances, capped off by Robin Williams's, which is probably the best cinema performance of his career. The movie deals with a lot of social and psychological themes - denial, repression, social marginalization, self-esteem, love - without becoming corny or a spoof. That is, the story can be taken seriously, and for Hollywood, which has a track record of reducing event he most complicated issues to the most simplistic level, this is a major accomplishment. The title character, Will, played admirably by Matt Damon, really serves as a metaphor for every person unable to actual their potential. Minnie Driver's performance is especially powerful, but this is Robin Williams's movie. His performance as the treating psychiatrist who is able to break through Will's resistance and defenses may be the positive portrayal of a mental health therapist in cinema history. This movie should be watched by anyone who is interested in mental health and by the public in general because this movie is about us.

Author: 15 September 2014
Review_Url: The constant  profanity jarred rather than added realism, and did little more than distract and make it seem the actors were trying much too hard. Though Will may have been a genius, but the writers sure are not.  The formulas in this film are familiar to any 2nd Year maths student in university.  The performances and direction, however,  are very appealing, turning the cliched and typical plot into an enjoyable film.

Author: 26 October 1999
Review_Url: I found this film to be quite boring, I enjoyed the beginning but as the film went on i just started getting board and lost interest.

Author: 5 September 2021
Review_Url: Uplifting and smart. Makes u realize the importance of overcoming your inner fears and live a life. Matt and Ben wrote the script in a young age. Wow.

Author: 5 March 2020
Review_Url: "I'd ask you about love, you'd probably quote me a sonnet. But you've never looked at a woman and been totally vulnerable. Known someone that could level you with her eyes, feeling like God put an angel on earth just for you."

Author: 11 June 2015
Review: Robin Williams best performance thanks to an incredibly solid script.
Review_Url: The script has the merit of bringing in its very well-developed narrative structure a collection of striking dialogues, such as when Sean recalls how he met his beloved wife and in his amusing recollection of the couple's idiosyncrasies, being also responsible for creating and developing ambiguous and complexes like Will and Sean himself, escaping the pitfalls common to this type of film, which usually seeks easy crying through Manichaean plots in the story. Not here: the situation builds up little by little, slowly, until, finally, we realize that something has changed. And that's precisely what's most interesting about Matt Damon's script and performance. His Will Hunting, an extremely troubled and arrogant young man, is changing so slowly that we are not able to perceive this transition until it is practically affected. Damon's acting is subtle, powerful. The scenes where he discusses love, sex, fate and loneliness with Robin Williams are perfect.

Author: 21 May 2023
Review: A moving and touching movie! Ths film It's about friendship, about how people can be saved by others, about how a word, a conversation, can be comforting, inspiring
Review_Url: I was very surprised at the variety and depth of the characters in the GWH script. (This is after all a Hollywood movie.) Several of them (Robin Williams, Minnie Driver and Affleck and his friends) could have been the center of their own movies.

Author: 27 December 1998
Review: Abundance of interesting characters in a polished film
Review_Url: A good piece of screenwriting by young cast members Matt Damon and Ben Affleck, but one that I don't think will stand the test of time. Matt Damon's (Will) performance as the troubled working-class genius in need of guidance is excellent. However, I think that this was too much of a feelgood movie and an endorsement of counselling, for it to be a truly great film. I found Minnie Driver's (Skylar) expressionless English accent thoroughly irritating and it destroyed, for me, the possibility of the romance between Will and Skylar being interesting.

Author: 23 December 2001
Review: Promising screenwriting debut but an overrated movie.
Review_Url: This is the incredible story of Will a working class young boy who besides working as a janitor first and in the building construction afterwards, is also a genius in mathematics and several other scientific fields which he learned all by himself. But simultaneously he is a petty delinquent for which he has already got a criminal record mainly for assaulting other people in street fights with the likes of him. Despite being a real genius he is also an insecure boy fearing life and love due to the very unhappy childhood he had, which makes it very hard that he can take advantage of his intellectual ability. It also leads him to be rude to those who want to help him since he doesn't trust anybody. All through the movie we see the work of the two men who try to bring him to life and to take conscience of his own value: a maths professor and above all a psychiatrist who had his own problems in life too. This is shown in a brilliant way in terms of players' performances, images and dialogues with deep analysis of feelings and behaviours. All the players are excellent. A special reference to Minnie Driver as the boy's girlfriend with her spiritual and intelligent look and her moving reactions to some of Will's difficult to understand attitudes. This story is genuine indeed in terms of sentiments and actions and very well put on film. One of the best movies of its year.

Author: 10 February 2006
Review_Url: This is a very good film.  Apart from the "apples" line, that is.  Robin Williams gives one of those occasional performances that make you weep for all the wasted time spent on the likes of Flubber, while the other leads match him.  For my money, it's the emotional journey of the older men that provides the best value, although Minnie Driver shines in what is easily her best ever role (well, maybe Tarzan).

Author: 15 January 2004
Review_Url: Although the production, writing and acting were exceptional, this movie still lacked something exciting. It just wasn't as inspirational as I think people think it is and I was bored at times. Regardless, very well done movie and still worth the watch.

Author: 31 December 2021
Review_Url:
It may not be the masterpiece some claim it is and it certainly is a bit too melodramatic at times but it's still a very well done movie telling a nice story.
By now it has become a classic that's worth watching and make your own opinion about!

Author: 27 December 2019
Review: Very well done; now a classic that's worth the watch!
Review_Url: You will feel the magic if you are searching some meaning in life.....

Author: 7 April 2020
Review_Url: I think this may be Robin William's finest role. His eyes show such caring and such pain, just like his character. Sadly this may not have been completely the character, pointing to the beauty all the more. This story knows what it is, and sticks with it.

Author: 8 June 2021
Review_Url: All hail the *intelligent* screenplay!

Author: 10 January 2013
Review_Url: I will start saying that I didn't gave a 10 just because Will character was unbelievable: A mix of genious nerd, tough fighter and way cool guy. It was at least strange.

Author: 13 May 2019
Review: Brutal acting. Loved the acting really...
Review_Url: Good Will Hunting has as its highlight the excellent map , so that won the Oscar for best original screenplay , the cast is good, Matt Damon , Robin Williams , Ben Affleck and etc , the chemistry of Sean and Will is amazing, Matt Damon is great Robin Williams made a performance that earned him an Oscar , and Ben Affleck is good, the script is amazing and unique, the pace I found median time was a little slow , and I especially did not like the soundtrack , I very bland, taking more that Good Will Hunting is a great, and also proves that even Ben Affleck not be a great actor, has a lot of talent both as a writer as Director . Note 8.1

Author: 16 May 2016
Review_Url: Good Will Hunting is an impressive movie on many levels not the least of which is the screenplay written by it's two young actors. One of the best scripts ever to be put on film.

Author: 30 July 2018
Review: "Sorry, I had to go see about a girl."
Review_Url: 'Good Will Hunting' is one of the best known and most popular films of the 90s. It's a powerful, moving drama about an unlikely friendship and features some of the best and most memorable acting performances of that decade, including a career defining performance from Matt Damon as the title character.

Author: 10 November 2017
Review_Url: If we are gonna judge movies based on loud cliches like (one of the classics, great legends, etc.) then we are missing the whole image. No one can deny that it is a classic, but not every classic is a great winner- at least for me. Now, Robin Williams has a lovely fitting performance as usual. Matt Demon is good in the movie too. The rest of the characters and actors are useless in the movie! Maybe that maths professor, but the rest are there to swear and curse. Weak repeated plot, boring irrelevant events.

Author: 22 June 2020
Review_Url: Good Will Hunting could have been a great movie, but it's nothing more than an average movie. It's been hyped up by so many people in the media, that the viewers are actually getting convinced that Matt Damon is the new miracle giving Hollywood new hope and glory, but it is quite the opposite. As an actor I think he's not convincing enough, maybe in the first part of the movie he seems to be able to let you forget he's just an actor, but at the end of the movie he starts to act out his character in such a way it actually brings down all what he did in the first part. As the writer of the screenplay he's not such a star either, again the beginning is okay, but the ending seems like a bad headache after a night of partying. The only truly remarkable thing about this movie is the excellent and undervalued performances by Robin Williams and Ben Affleck. Matt Damon and Minnie Driver should have been the last choices for their characters.

Author: 6 August 1998
Review: The best of the worst movies...
Review_Url: A troubled math genius (Matt Damon) working as a janitor tries to turn his life around with the help of a kindly psychologist (Robin Williams).

Author: 2 July 2010
Review: Equal parts love story, coming-of-age struggle, ode to friendship, and therapy session.
Review_Url: Decades ago I watched this and thought it was a pretentious piece of crap. Tonight I watched it thinking perhaps I was the pretentious piece of crap but no, it was the movie. I did find Stellan Skarsgard a pleasure to watch.

Author: 5 December 2020
Review: Yeah, as bad as I remembered.
Review_Url: It's very predictable that a movie like this would soon be placed into that undefined category of "good" recent movies, which includes any film having the smallest bit of sincerity and meaning. The fact that the popular trend is toward the visual and that special effects are replacing plots and subtle nuances tends to lead the average viewer to the opinion that any film that attempts these is a grand effort. This is not true. "Good Will Hunting" does not even have a well-defined plot, but that fits into the movie acceptably: it's an extraordinary man's search for himself through love, psychoanalysis, and philosophy. The premier problem is that the movie overplays it's best card: Matt Damon's(character's) incredible brain. There is a certain point at which the audience should halt its fascination at his mental profencies and sigh in boredom. It's unfortunate that this was not the case for most theaters. Though the meaning of life and gifted individuals are good themes for movies, they are not original, and this "tear-jerker" makes no unique contributions to either idea. In fact, if you want to see real meaning in a popular movie, rent "Rocky", a title which many supposed "film experts" would probably not want to admit conveys deeper human meaning than most "good" movies, like (appropriately) Good Will Hunting. Shame on you,  movie fans, for falling in love with such a butchered attempt at profundity.

Author: 7 January 1999
Review: An over-rated drama for popular culture
Review_Url: good will hunting came out in 1997 its 2h 6min of pure | Drama 8/10 directed by Gus Van Sant who done a lot of brilliant find yourself stories like finding forester and my own private Idaho he is at it again in this one with a slew of awards it won 2 awards Oscar Best Actor in a Supporting Role with a robin Williams playing a psychologist with his own troubles trying to help someone who is gifted and Best Writing, Screenplay Written Directly for the Screen with 2 newcomers and stars of the future Matt Damon Ben Affleck Robin Williams ... Sean Maguire Ben Affleck ... Chuckie Sullivan / Stellan Skarsgård ... Prof. Gerald Lambeau /Minnie Driver ... Skylar / Casey Affleck ... Morgan O'Mally /Cole Hauser ... Billy McBride this film was also nominated for best picture in 1997 A touching tale of a wayward young man who struggles to find his identity, living in a world where he can solve any problem, except the one brewing deep within himself, until one day he meets his soul mate who opens his mind and his heart his mind is the best in M.I.T university in America and Boston is his home town but there is a irishness to the film so Matt Damon character is the cleaner but he is a genius will played by Matt Damon was nominated for the role as best actor but will is headstrong penniless and fails life's lessons and he is in love with skylar played by the beautiful Minnie driver will loves her but is driving her crazy Wildly charismatic. Impossibly brilliant. Totally rebellious. For the first 20 years of his life, Will Hunting has called the shots. Now he's about to meet his match he is facing jail after run in with the law to many times he gets a second chance when his professor see his odd equations but feels sorry for him and gets him help and Sean McGuire played excellently tries to figure him out to see what makes him tick get the inspiration flowing it grossed in america$138,339,411 . Add Robin Williams in perhaps his best role ever (too close to Good Morning Vietnam for me to make the call), and you have a wonderfully entertaining movie.Ben Affleck is convincing as the best friend to a genius, able to effectively play the joker and the friend who would "lay down in traffic for you". Matt Damon's portrayal of that genius realizing that life has something more to offer than batting cages and bars is equally stunning. And Robin Williams certainly leaves nothing to be desired in this inspiring and emotionally film my 166 review

Author: 20 July 2016
Review: a good therapist hunts the truth to answers he seeks in a janitors destructive evolutionary genius way to change his direction
Review_Url: Unfairly dismissed by some as confusing, this kind of sentimental character piece needs a tight focus so all of the nuances of the characters shine through. The characters in this film have a lot of depth and the realism with which they are portrayed by the actors is shocking at times. The acting is very effective. From an artistic standpoint, there were some plot elements and character developments I didn't think were totally needed. They do however drive the story, which seemed to be their purpose, so I can accept them. Williams is one of the world's supreme artistic talents. It will bring you to tears and make you laugh.

Author: 19 August 2014
Review_Url: This movie is fantastic, heartwarming, realistic, hilarious, and overall a wonderful piece of film history. Robin Williams is pure and raw and a person of heart, this is one of his best performances. He is perfect for this role and mastered it beyond anyone could comprehend. He perfected this role into a Masterpiece of Acting. Matt Damon absolutely was perfect for this role as well. The whole movie and story and the acting is perfect! A film that everyone must at least check out. This movie will live on in the history of cinema for all of Eternity! Overall, 10/10. A perfect film for everyone to watch and witness Cinema History.

Author: 19 April 2022
Review_Url: Good Will Hunting is a great movie. Of all the films I have seen Matt Damon in, this is the best one. His character isn't an action hero like in the Bourne Trilogy, nor is a comical thief in the Ocean's series. He plays a youth in south Boston, driven by his fears of abandonment and a lack of trust in people. However, his unique math abilities are discovered by a college professor (Stellan Skarsgard) who gives him an opportunity to change his original lifestyle from a street punk to someone of value and good qualities.

Author: 29 March 2008
Review_Url: Ambitious drama from a screenplay by star Damon and co-star Affleck, about an underachieving orphan from South Boston that works as a janitor at MIT, but finally finds guidance in his genius from a Community College professor/therapist (Williams) who is able to empathize with the pains of the world while also giving the titular character insight into the overlooked beauties of life and some well-deserved tough-love too. Driver and Skarsgård indeed play an important part in carrying this wonderful story, but it's Hauser and the Affleck Brothers that really help give this modern-day classic the above-par boost that we all remember it for.

Author: 31 January 1999
Review_Url: Gus Van Sant's Good Will Hunting is one of the most inspirational movies that were ever made, the movie tells the story of a janitor at MIT who has a gift in math but needs direction in life after one too many run-ins with the law. The movie stars Matt Damon as that character named Will Hunting. Also the movie has a great supporting cast such as a young Ben Affleck,Robin Williams, Stellan Skarsgard,and Minnie Driver who gives a decent performance. Director Gus Van Sant has crafted of what I think is the best movie of 1997 because this is a true acting movie, the movie compares to inspirational films such as Million Dollar Baby, Rocky, The Blind Side, Rain Man, The Pursuit of Happiness, Remember the Titans,To Kill a Mockingbird, Lawrence of Arabia, Braveheart, etc..I personally would recommend this movie even though there is a few bad scenes but this is a movie that will stay with you for a very very long time.

Author: 1 June 2014
Review_Url: 'Good Will Hunting' is a drama that earned $225 million, whereas the budget of the movie is $10 million. It was directed by Gus Van Sant in 1997.

Author: 14 July 2020
Review_Url: In my mind, there was no movie better then "Good Will Hunting" in the year 1997.  Yes I thought it was even better than that movie with the boat that sinks in the end.  To me this movie was better acted, headed by the mind-blowing performances of Matt Damon and Robin Williams.  The greatest special effects in a movie is the skill of the actors, and this movie certainly displayed their actor's skills.  It was a touching and very unique movie that has characters that are completely unforgettable.

Author: 16 April 1999
Review_Url: I have just re-watched this movie about 10 years after last seeing it. And I realise now what all the fuss is about. The script is fantastic. And the acting is perfectly judged. The film has so many things going for it. Matt Damon and Ben Affleck are superb, and they just gel so well on screen. Their gang of friends is lewd and crude but very affectionate and best of all, they swear authentically and talk in native accents. Robin Williams is a strong character as usual but most of the time is quite restrained, and acts well off other characters. Stellan Skarsgaard is perfectly convincing as a wily mathematics professor who is an old friend and rival of Williams' character. Minnie Driver acts well and has some great scenes, but I think her character is too much of "the love interest" -- it's a pity. The plot hums along nicely and, all in all, it's a satisfying movie.

Author: 10 August 2013
Review_Url: Good Will Hunting is a good movie, no question. It is a long way, however, from a great movie. As I watched the film I honestly enjoyed it and found it credibly done, but as I came away, I had a lingering sense that I had been duped. This movie is not worth all the hoopla (and awards) it garnered, something I can only attribute to Ben and Matt's 'fresh' faces. The story is a long way from original, following fairly predictable routes, some scenes badly expose the immaturity of the writers. Once again, a good movie, not a great movie.

Author: 5 August 1998
Review_Url: "Good Will Hunting" is a delightful and inspiring fiction written by Ben Affleck and Matt Damon, who are not only good actors but good writers, And especially, great storytellers. The script tells the story of Will, a young man of 20 years with a past and a troubled present, who is discovered by a renowned mathematician as a genius, even bearer of this incredible tone, the same denies and questions the feeling of life, intelligence , Future, love and society. This questioning present in the film is what shapes his moral, which is to conjecture the sense of friendship and life, to Will friendship defines life, and his best friend makes him see that he has a bright future and that is not worth it The stagnation in exchange for his friendship, thus showing himself, really, a great and faithful friend, love is put on agenda and even the choices of life itself, because sometimes what the heart says is worth more than reason, Even so, the feature gets very focused on Will's character and leaves all those messages aside, including Professor Sean's character, who is fabulous and extremely three-dimensional. The film plays a lot with the camera, we have a lot of zoom in and out, quick cuts and frames changes, and a very expensive gray photograph from the 80s - even the movie being 97 - the soundtrack is little present but director Gus Van Sant plays with visual references and uses the culture to mock the viewer, when smarter, more blind and more being manipulated and lost, is a questionable message, but the film explains it very well for the viewer more attention. Matt Damon looks great on the role, boyish face, and boy pose and he understands his character as few, even because he wrote it himself, wrote it and knew how to live it, it's not a brilliant and out-of- the-way performance, but it's a great Acting of someone who does not even seem to be acting, just living the character, Robin Williams is wonderful, he passes an air of pure peace mixed with remarkable uneasiness, his character is wonderful. Gus Van Sant is one of those full directors, he's not cool, but he dominates the various areas of a set and always does a good job. Finally, "Indomitable Genius" is a remarkable film, and a delightful fiction that reads like a life lesson.

Author: 29 July 2017
Review: A delightful fiction that looks like a life lesson
Review_Url: Well, for all of you out there who love the F word and MF, this movie is for you.   For anyone who desires a storyline, this one is quite minimal.  Who wants to hear the F word for a whole movie?  If cursing as well as a bonus of bad actors is a movie to you, then see it.  The ironic thing is that I don't mind cursing in a movie so long it's to prove a point; but in this movie, it was meant to be simply crude and I saw no point in it.

Author: 24 April 2020
Review_Url: Will Hunting is a troubled young man who spends his free time hanging around bars and cleaning the floors of a university. However, Will isn't a typical youngster as he has unbelievable mathematic abilities and an outstanding photographic memory. Will soon gets into trouble but a professor who's seen what he's capable of makes a proposition which includes Will to see a psychiatrist. A psychiatrist after another refuses to see Will anymore as he's so uncooperative. Will eventually meets his match, a psychiatrist Sean McGuire, who finally makes Will to open up his mind and think about what he wants to do with his life.

Author: 27 March 2022
Review_Url: I tell you this. 'Good Will Hunting' will be one of my all time favorites. I enjoy seeing homage to extreme intelligence. The truly gifted are such a rare commodity. And most of them do have problems, such as relating to others. Seeing Will drive off into the sunset to Stanford, California and the one woman in his life who truly is his other half, what a clincher and a perfect ending to a magnificent movie. Love pays off. The only reason for living. And the final restrained rapport between Matt and Robin proves that intimacy need not be sensual. What a movie!!!

Author: 12 May 2020
Review: I come to your house every day to pick you up
Review_Url: Well made with some nice musical numbers thrown into the mix. Nothing particularly different in the cinematography but still well put together. On the performance front, Matt Damon did an excellent job as Will Hunting, as did Robin Williams as Sean Maguire. I also thought Stellan Skarsgård did a very good job as Prof. Gerald Lambeau, also Ben Affleck as Chuckie Sullivan and Minnie Driver as Skylar. Also worthy of note were Casey Affleck and Cole Hauser as Will's friends Morgan O'Mally and Billy McBride.

Author: 16 July 2012
Review_Url: The story has a genius. Two fabulous actors lead the show. Though they are a different sort of genius from the rest, they stand out. One genius (Matt) who is a janitor at a prestigious university shows his identity by solving a fabulous math equation. He is discovered as the new Ramanujan of our time. Though this tale so unlikely to happen stands firmly. The other genius is Of (Robin) who comes in contact with this cocky kid by mistake then for a favor for an old friend. The two really have all of it together. Fight, stare, compete and eventually share. The greatness of this movie is in the bonding of two souls. Then freeing and soaring away into their destinies. Magical flick with deep messages. Perfect watch for humor and inner growth. Almost all the characters have a strong stand, save for the heroin. Their are some immortal scenes in this movie. Don't miss the magic of life. Truly beautiful. Moving and a tale of love.

Author: 27 November 2014
Review: A prodigy Janitor solves unexpectedly one of Ramanujan math equations. He is then discovered. The kid has problems and in comes a psychiatrist.
Review_Url: I believe movies r a way to look thru eyes of people who looked beyond the mundane. Who explored Human feelings, emotions...beyond just love, anger, lust n sadness..Good Will Hunting is one such svelte work of art.

Author: 13 September 2010
Review: Feel the Bliss of a Great Mind
Review_Url: This is a difficult film to rate as the fact that Affleck and Damon wrote it and it did so well, and the screenplay is so good is distracting. All the performances are good but it is the relationship between Matt Damon's Will and Robin Williams' Psychologist Sean that is the most compelling and the genius of the piece. Will Hunting is a broken yet incredibly intelligent young man who's not had the breaks in life, finds inspiration and meaning in his sessions with a compulsory therapist.

Author: 9 May 2020
Review_Url: This movie is just fabulous! I am a huge Mat Damon fan and he really shines in this one. The script is excellent and the performances are deeply heartfelt. This is a movie that I watch again and again as it makes me cry. Please Hollywood - make more moves like this!

Author: 1 April 2020
Review_Url: This is not a good movie. Let's make that clear from the beginning. The writing, which intentionally carry the whole package, it's barely mediocre. Some banter resembles that of shows like Young Sheldon, and not the good episodes. Other dialogues are so over the top, so vehemently direct and so unaware of the circumstances that one has to cringe or laugh in reaction. At one point in the story the movie seems to forget the concept of narrative progression. And oh boy, don't let me start about the ridiculous and self-indulgent plot. Do I have to mention how inconsistent it is? Or how stupid? Just from the get go. Anyway, is not that awful and there's a couple of thought provoking lines here and there, and Robin Williams is good, so all hope is not lost. The direction has its moments in which just walks away to make the character writing shine, and that would be acceptable in a better movie, but not here. The mood, I think, is an obvious choice; intimate and tranquil. The music, however, seemed tiresome to me.

Author: 1 September 2018
Review: Some good touches but overall silly and cringy
Review_Url: Here's a math problem: whats (2xB) X (2xA)? Two times beautiful times two times amazing, equals, the hit motion picture, "Good Will Hunting". The film follows around a Harvard janitor that breaks the law most often, but has a mind like a mathematician. Weekly, he visits his match, a psychologist who helps him with his life's steps. The film just really focuses on finding his true destiny. It felt like a true-to-life feature about real people. This movie is really enjoying, and it's one of the more finest movies ever made. Written in a powerful script by Ben Affleck and Matt Damon, who also starred as characters in the movie, and including other members of the cast including Robin Williams and Minnie Driver, the film takes our lives to the next level, and teaches us to find our true destiny and to know who we really are as people. Matt Damon brings the performance of a lifetime as Will Hunting, but it's he and Robin Williams, as Damon's psychologist, that really stand up for this movie. Director Gus Van Sant has provided a heartwarming movie with a beautiful message, and he improves with no doubt. I really enjoyed for its fine writing, brilliant music score, and great characters. The film was an excellent choice to be known as one of the best movies of all time. "Good Will Hunting", in my review, "an inspirational national treasure of a movie."

Author: 21 May 2011
Review: Good Will Hunting (1997) - How Do You Like Them Apples?
Review_Url: If you've seen the movie Paycheck, you would not assume that Ben Affleck has brilliant writing talent in him. He apparently does and, along with childhood pal Matt Damon, in Good Will Hunting, he has penned a nearly perfect script. Good Will Hunting will make you laugh and make you cry. It will make you angry and sad and happy and excited all at once. It makes you root for its protagonist one moment and then hate him for being so stubborn the next. In short, it is one of the most powerful screenplays ever written.

Author: 23 October 2008
Review: The Best Movie not in the IMDb Top 250- one of the best ever made
Review_Url: Good Will Hunting, is a damn good movie.  I cannot believe that ben affleck and matt damon wrote this wonderful script.  It has some of the best written scenes i have ever seen.  Both damon and affleck are excellent in the movie and the supporting cast led by williams is awesome.  this was one that i instantly fell in love with and it should be a piece of everyones home video or dvd collection.

Author: 23 March 2001
Review: Definitely in my top 5 all time
Review_Url: I think this might probably be the best movie of the late '90's. The screenplay is wonderfully written by Damon and Affleck. It is really touching and the acting performances are high class. Robin Williams plays one of his best roles in years, although I always love his movies. They couldn't have found any actor more suitable for this role. It's actually a shame he had to wait such a long time until he won his first Academy Award.

Author: 30 October 2005
Review: Now that's what I call acting!
Review_Url: Good Will Hunting may be cliché and predictable, but still an excellent film. Affleck and Damon, with the help of both Rob Reiner and William Goldman, created a history that is at the same time smart and very beautiful and touching. The conflicts of the main character may be very relatable to anyone. For example, how many times you've realized that you could do easily certain things, but you refused to do so 'only' because they aren't what you want for your life?

Author: 15 November 2013
Review_Url: Good story, excellent acting - especially by Matt Damon, really outdistancing all the others - and an awakener of many thoughts. Just one thing: what do geniuses say, really?

Author: 21 February 2003
Review_Url: Though Good Will Hunting was a very enjoyable movie, I couldn't help but feel that Will, is a bit of a superhero; He can win a street fight, and a mental fight, while taking on a psychological fight and an emotional fight, which too, he won. Then I later realized that perhaps, Will Hunting is, Jason Bourne.

Author: 25 February 2018
Review_Url: Although the storyline was good, the terrible language was really a turn-off and ruined the movie for me.  I don't feel that I am a prude, but I don't know anyone who talks like that and the movie would have been so much better without it.

Author: 26 November 1999
Review_Url: "Good Will Hunting" (1997) is an intriguing drama about guilt, life, and love. If you want to get as much out of it as possible, there are a few things you need to keep in mind before watching:

Author: 6 September 2019
Review_Url: Knowing Damon mostly from his tough guy roles like The Departed, and The Bourne Series, I was surprised by his acting in Good Will Hunting, especially because he was so young then. But taking a look at the list of movies he has done now, I have to admit that he is one hell of an actor. He has done so many different roles - which shows his capability and proves his talent. Affleck doesn't have much screen-time in this, but plays his character well enough, as did his brother Casey Affleck, and Hauser. Williams will be missed for making these tear jerking moments, as he is able to portray empathetic characters so well.

Author: 15 November 2016
Review_Url: Strong, naturalistic performances and the story is solid. It also evokes a strong sense of location and community, obviously close to the writers heart. That said, I don't find I connect with this film; it's just a bit too jam packed with shmaltz for my taste. I can definitely see why it's well regarded though.

Author: 3 December 2021
Review_Url: It's hard to believe that in a single year so many outstanding and unforgettable films hit the box office, but 1997 was indeed such a year. In any other this film would have walked away with Oscars for ''Best Director'' and ''Best Picture'', but suffice it say I'm grateful that the team of B. Affleck & M. Damon won for their outstanding screenplay. Damon's ''Best Actor'' nod was also well deserved and the two partners worked in tandem to play up Damon while playing down an equally strong B. Affleck (the latter shows his outstanding potential in ''Armageddon''). Most difficult this must have been, for otherwise the characters of Robin Williams and Minnie Farmer, both of whom got Oscar nods and the former who finally took home a statue, would have been lost in the shuffle. This film and its story were pure talent from start to finish, totally original and a refreshing change. Underdog over spoiled yuppie -- that's my kind of film -- and one's got to be happy for Williams who finally bagged an Oscar. Top rating (5 stars of 5) !

Author: 30 September 2004
Review: Don't forget the value of a great public library system !
Review_Url: Your "gift" is the people who love you.

Author: 1 April 2008
Review_Url: This film about a deeply wounded genius soul is by itself a therapy. To be honest, the first Gus Van Sant directed movie I saw was Even Cowgirls Get the Blues and I didn't get it at all. And looking at its rating, few did. But this one got my heart. Clever, deep, way deeper than it appears at first...

Author: 29 November 2020
Review: Beautiful, human story, reflection of human complexity
Review_Url: While plot wise it wasn't really that innovative, it more than made up for it in the dialogue.  I still refuse to believe those f***ers Damen and Afleck wrote it themselves but until its proven false, I will give credit where it is deserved.  The dialogue was riveting, it really was.  Gus Van Sant also did a good job adding feeling and color where dialogue was absent. Hell, even the score chosen was appropriate for the scenes they portrayed. Williams did a tremendous outshine everyone job acting, and even Afleck and Damen were far from shabby.  And as much as we all like to hate Driver, she too was ok I guess.  The movie from start to finish was told smoothly and was crafted deliberately.  Still, it was those small tidbits of dialogue that made the movie incredible and unique.  Few can deny the power of the script.

Author: 9 December 2003
Review: Hell, it was a good movie.
Review_Url: Will Hunting, a janitor at MIT, has a gift for mathematics but needs help from a psychologist to find direction in his life.

Author: 12 April 2012
Review: "Some people can never believe in themselves, until someone believes in them"
Review_Url: Often, when a Robin Williams character is the most palatable feature of a film, the film may be avoided and the filmgoer's admission may be saved and the filmgoer may enjoy $7.00 worth of candy and cake (There are exceptions - "Dead Poets'" is one, of course).  Good Will Hunting doubtlessly sold lots of issues of Teen People magazine - but it also kept a lot of good filmgoers from enjoying a lot of good candy and cake.

Author: 31 October 1999
Review_Url: One might think of Matt Damon and Ben Affleck as one-hit-wonders after watching their one and only writing credit come to life in the magnificent "Good Will Hunting." In the wake of its success, both went on to become quite prominent in Hollywood, but only for their acting abilities, leading some to question if they really wrote it themselves or not. But surely, if someone (whether it be William Goldman or Kevin Smith) served as a ghostwriter, they wouldn't have been able to keep their mouths shut all this time. We are speaking of an Oscar winning movie here, afterall. No, the two men (especially Damon) deserve all the credit in the world and it's a shame that they haven't written another movie since, because "Good Will Hunting" has enough soul to eclipse any big-budget block-buster they may have done after the fact.

Author: 16 April 2009
Review: Worth watching, even if you have to put it on layaway!
Review_Url: A lot of things have been said about this fantastic movie, and I only hope to add a few more praises.

Author: 18 June 2020
Review_Url: It has taken me several years and many viewings of this film to finally be able to give it the review that I think it deserves, from my point of view. And the very fact this has been a laboured decision has probably been a good thing. Very few of my favourite films have been ones that I can sit down and review right away. They're usually so profound I have to experience them at different points in my life and at every turn, be amazed and vindicated by them.

Author: 8 February 2008
Review: An underrated film that may be rendered 'classic' by the passage of time.
Review_Url: This movie is genius. When robin williams passed away i honestly thought he was an overrated actor and considering his repertoire of "RV" and stupid movies like that one, I just didn't have too much respect for robin williams. but after watching this movie i felt dumbfounded to even minorly think that. robin williams' character gives me goosebumps when he talks. and that doesn't mean he has cheezy lines, its because it just felt like the words coming out of his mouth were real. that he wasn't given a script. he was having a normal conversation

Author: 1 April 2015
Review_Url: "Good Will Hunting" is not one of those conventional Hollywood dramas that are filled with sentimental moments, melodramatic situations and stereotypical characters. It is a film that  focuses on realistic characters, their complex lives and the things life has to give them, whether they want them or not. Something every human being can relate too. "Good Will Hunting" is a genuinely good film, that has qualities I consider a rarity these days in movies. This may sound over the top, but this movie will most likely be one of the most memorable dramas of the 90`s.  Matt Damon and Ben Affleck`s honest and invigorating script transfers almost perfectly onto the big screen, with the help of director Gus Van Sant. "Good Will Hunting" is about a young, cocky but deeply troubled young man named Will Hunting. He lives in South Boston with his street bum friends, but there`s something that separates him from the rest; He`s a genius. After an MIT professor accidentally discovers his gift, Will`s life starts to change, more dramatically than he thinks. Two strangers almost simultaneously then enter Will`s life; Sean Maguire, a widowed psychologist who tries to help Will, played greatly by Robin Williams. And Skylar (played equally as good by Minnie Driver), a vibrant Harvard student who quickly falls in love with Will. Will`s relationship with both them and his blue-collar friend Chuckie (Ben Affleck), all seem to deeply affect him, making it more difficult for Will to realise what he truly needs. The ending of the film sort of leaves you hanging, but you will no doubt me moved. "Good Will Hunting" is pretty down-to-earth film, but it is enriched with an indescribable power that is probably generated by all the exceptional performances, the script and Gus Van Sant`s unparalleled direction. A satisfying, powerful and thought-provoking movie.

Author: 18 March 1999
Review_Url: A math genius, Will, grows up in the back streets of Boston. Will has never sought any formal education and frequently gets in trouble with the law. He gets a job as a janitor at Harvard University. Between sweeping floors and cleaning toilets, he finds the time to solve extremely complicated math equations. A professor at Harvard attempts to take him under his wing and to save him from his latest prison sentence. The professor guarantees the court that Will will seek psychotherapy. After a number of therapists refuse to work with him, the professor asks an old friend to counsel Will. Enter Sean, Robin Williams, a man who also grew up in the back streets of Boston. Sean is able to relate to the troubled Will, and thus the healing begins I adored this film when it first opened. It had a fresh, funny, emotionally-charged script. The script was written by two young writers, who had lots of potential to become the most celebrated writers in Hollywood. Instead of sticking to the writing, Ben Affleck and Matt Damon chose the easier path. They became "action" movie stars on the back of Good Will Hunting and left their writing behind. I always thought that this was a shame, that they didn't stick with writing screenplays. Because of this, I think the film lost some of its initial impact. Don't get me wrong. It is still a notable work. When most audiences watch it, they find themselves cheering Will on, as he "cuts" elitist college students down to size. The most hardened and cynical viewers will find it hard not to shed a tear, as Will confronts his past. But what really makes this film masterful is that we are not just told that Will is a Genius. He proves it in every scene. Whether you are listening to his piquant repartee with other characters or his philosophy on life, you are struck by the intelligence of his remarks. The dialogue throughout the film is exceptional. It is earthy and natural (to stay true to the background of Will's character), but it is also adept and sometimes quite, profound.

Author: 27 February 2008
Review: I'm pumped! Let the healing begin!
Review_Url: I'm not sure why I like "Good Will Hunting" so much. The plot is such a simple story of Will Hunting (Matt Damon), a young man with intelligence way beyond his years, yet all he is choosing to do with his life is cleaning the floors at his job and hanging out with his friends. After getting in trouble with the law, college professor Sean Maquire (Robin Williams, in his Oscar-winning role) is the only person willing to counsel him and turn his life around. Maybe I enjoy this film because I relate so well to it, as I am a college student unsure of what to do with my life. The film has rightly been described as a "slow-burner," and I would agree. It was during my second viewing that the film's greatness suddenly hit me, and I really began to like it. It entertains but also brings tears to my eyes. It has the same inspirational value as Robin Williams' earlier film "Dead Poets Society," for which he also should have won an Academy Award. Although I prefer this film, since it focuses more on inspiring a single person rather than an entire group, both movies are excellent. Maybe it's not an entirely perfect film, but watch this one (more than once if necessary) and be prepared to be moved.

Author: 9 August 2008
Review_Url: I've read several complaints by people who didn't like this movie, and they all say the same thing (i.e. no one can be that smart, how did Will have time to read all those books?, even geniuses have to get some formal education, how was he an expert on everything?, etc. etc. etc.).

God knows what would've happened if I watched this in the privacy of my own home! Stellar film with a chuck ton of heart. Felt authentic, was original.
