Author: 12 August 2013
Review: Good movie !!!! Better Soul and Characters
Review_Url: I find it hard to believe that the people who rated this movie low really got the point of Good Will Hunting. I am moved every time I watch it to the point of tears. The language and the acting is just so incredibly real. Everyone knows a Will Hunting type and can relate to that. Or at least I know I do. The message about letting people in and trusting others isn't slammed into your face. Rather, it's shown through real emotion. Although most of us know a Will, I wish we could all have a Sean in our lives. I love this movie and I never get sick of it. It is so original and well written. I stand by my rating of ten. Give it a second chance all of you negative people.

Author: 17 January 2005
Review_Url: As you can see, this is easily one of my all time favs...still. It's timeless and still one of the best. Absolutely the best acting by everyone, Matt Damon, Ben Affleck, Robin Williams, Minnie Driver, Stellan Skarsgard, and everyone else. A powerful, unforgettable Academy Award winning screenplay, that's extremely original. And it earned Robin Williams his first (and sadly his only) Oscar. I love it still to this day.....and forever

Author: 27 March 2000
Review: One of my all time favs
Review_Url: This movie can only be described in one word: Unbelievable. Following in the footsteps of Damon and Affleck, trying to make my own work instead of trying to find it, it truly amazes me how well and how hard those two worked over the years to put this movie on the screen. I think, that if Titanic hadn't come out in '97, that Good Will Hunting would've won best picture in a heartbeat, because, well it's hard to beat Titanic, anyway...

Author: 23 June 2003
Review_Url: I was triggered by the first review that popped out by someone who stated that as a therapist thinks Will Hunting is a sociopath and stating some opinions I found honestly problematic.

Author: 26 December 2021
Review: The classic still relevant in 2021 when it comes to different therapy practices and the importance of companionship in the process of healing
Review_Url: There are so many things to comment on regarding this film.  Unbelievable performances all around, great writing, nice use of lighting by Mr. VanSant, great fight scene shot at 14 fps, I believe.  The two main characters (Sean and Will) are delineated beautifully, deepening as the film progresses... And then there is Robin Williams, who once again proves that stand-up comics really can act.  Everything he says is just perfect.  Amazing.  Blew Titanic out of the water.

Author: 23 November 1998
Review: The Best Picture of the Year
Review_Url: When he worked as a cleaner, only two people in the world knew the solution formula, when he used rich historical knowledge and clear logical thinking to fight against Harvard students in the bar, when he fell in love and kissed the heroine, he was entangled in the quilt,When he said firmly that I don't love you, when he met a professor of psychology, when he made a rant, when he talked about an anecdote about airplanes, when he cried bitterly, when he laughed. This is a man who cannot be fascinated.

Author: 7 June 2020
Review_Url: I don't even know how many times I have watched this film. Every time it gets me, without fail. Superb acting, script, story. This film is some of Robin Williams finest work, in an incredibly illustrious career. It's no surprise that Damon and both the Afflecks went onto so much success.

Author: 24 December 2018
Review_Url: Good Will Hunting is a realistic movie that has a message about people and life.  It works on many levels - the characters and plot are interesting as a well told story, the interactions between Will and the psychiatrist are revealing and compelling, and the questions it raises about life and lifestyle choices are deep and complex. I also really appreciated the relationship between the two friends. The conversation they have while working, when Will's friend tells him about his hope that Will be able to break free of this life, is so real and so beautifully done that I can't think of many film moments that come close. Robin Williams does a great job of creating a character who is flawed, yet incredibly capable of reaching Will and helping him to change his life. To add to the realism, the psychiatrist is also changed for the better because of his interactions with Will. Finally, the photography, attention to detail, and the incredibly good choice of settings and background helps to make this movie believable and great.  Everything just comes together so well, it should be considered the best movie of the year.  I give it 5 stars, the highest rating available.

Author: 23 June 2001
Review: This was a movie that affected me strongly and caused me to do some deep thinking.
Review_Url: What is your purpose in life? Well, that's a hard question to answer, given that there is and incredible number of possible roles to fulfil. Some of us has quite an easy choice regarding that matter, and they usually end up doing a safe structured routine that they don't necessarily have a passion for. However, a set few of us, get to live one's passion, and flourish doing what you love.

Author: 2 February 2022
Review_Url: I watched this one with dad. I was only 8 years old. It was more than a good movie, it was a lesson in life, love, hurt and pain. So much expression from such a young actor. Man did I cry a lot. Saw GWH over a dozen times now, and I still cry...

Author: 28 March 2018
Review_Url: I was extraordinarily moved by this film. This film is about a boy, Will, who is a genius about mathematics. He is intelligent, but he is poor at the relationship with others. That is the part we can have sympathy for. Each character has their own problems. This film successfully describes human touch, which attracts audiences. This film shows us the human relationship of friends, lover and human. There are a lot of good phrases in this film. One of my favorite phrase is 'The question is whether or not you are perfect for each other.', which is impressive for me because it is the essence for love between men and women and friends. As we see the growth of characters, our horizon for our life widens. This film brings a lot of helpful tips for life into my value. Besides, 'Will' which is used in title and the name of the lead character includes multiple meanings, so the title is the best for this film. This film is the best ever.

Author: 12 August 2017
Review_Url: Splendid! years have passed since i have seen such a movie. From the beginning till the end captures you with its plot. The effort to save a troublesome genius who doesn't like to fit in society that's something worth fighting for.I believe one of the best movies of its kind,and the end a fantastic however expected one.

Author: 13 May 1999
Review: touching as much as it gets
Review_Url: I loved this movie.  I absolutely loved it.  I was fascinated by every single aspect of it.  Sure, the plot wasn't the most realistic, but who cares?  Movies are entertainment, and that's all.  The profanity was not that excessive if you spend any time at all with many lower to middle-class people around the age of the characters.  In fact, it was downright realistic. As for the acting, it was wonderful watching Damon portray this character who has to struggle with what he thinks he wants, what he is told he should want, and what he finally realizes he really wants.  No, I don't think it was the best performance of the year, but it was definitely one of the top five and worthy of a Best Actor nomination.  The chemistry between him and Minnie Driver was electric, particularly during their first date and again in the scene in her apartment before he leaves.  Robin Williams, in my opinion, delivers his best performance.  Sure, it's the typical Williams-drama character from Dead Poets Society and the like, but this character was better with the mental games and interactions with Will.  The best part of this movie was watching the relationship develop between Will and Sean.  This wasn't an epic movie, nothing too profound, but it was a small movie about love, relationships, and finding yourself, and in this capacity I think it was wonderful.  9.5 out of 10.

Author: 28 January 1999
Review_Url:
Twenty-year-old Will Hunting of South Boston works as a janitor at MIT, despite him being a self-taught mathematical genius. He spends his free time drinking with his friends, Chuckie, Morgan, and Billy. After solving a difficult high-level math problem on a chalkboard in the hallways of MIT, his talent is discovered by Professor Lambeau, who decides to help Will reach his full potential. When Will gets in a fight and is arrested for attacking a police officer, Professor Lambeau takes a deal to get leniency for Will if he gets treatment from therapist Sean Maguire. Although the movie plunges into and addresses the emotions of each character, like the psychological trauma that Will experiences, it still manages to incorporate lots of humor. There are many instances where the witty banter and hilarious exchanges, especially between Will and his friends, cause the audience to immediately respond with a laugh.
 "Good Will Hunting" was written by Matt Damon and Ben Affleck, who portray the two best friends, Will and Chuckie. One might stipulate that the writing and on-screen connection between the two would be mediocre, considering that Damon and Affleck were just in college when they began writing the script and the fact that they were not the big named actors that they are now. But, because Damon and Affleck are actually childhood besties in really life, they make the friendship between Will and Chuckie (and even with Billy and Morgan) all the more authentic. Their friendship and loyalty towards each other is the glue that keeps the movie together; they accept each other for who they are. The already well established relationship between Damon and Affleck reinforces their performances, reminding the audience that family does not just come in one form. Damon and Affleck didn't just grow up as best friends, they also grew up on Boston, which is where the movie is set. The movie included many scenes that were actually shot in the city. For example, the famous scene where Sean has a heart-to-heart talk with Will at a park was actually shot at Boston Public Garden. The movie has had such an impact on audiences that the bench where the conversation took place became a memorial for Robin Williams after his passing.
 Not only is the bond between Will and Chuckie unmistakable, but also their character development throughout the movie. Usually, the main character in a movie is moving towards a goal and the audience is rooting for them along the way. But, in this film, that is not the case. Will Hunting is not someone who embraces his intellectual gift and, in fact, seems to be against accepting it at all. This sort-of creates a frustration in the audience which, in turn, makes them root for him even more since they want him to learn to embrace it. The movie may seem typical-about some genius kid-but it actually touches upon two very important topics. First off, it addresses the psychology of Will. The movie dives into the psychology of Will and how the psychological traumas from his past have affected him all the way to adulthood. Also, in the movie, Will is faced with a decision: to use his intellectual gift to its full potential, or to pursue love. Just like how Chuckie hopes for Will to be gone one day when he comes to pick him up, the audience wishes for Will to embrace his gift and reach his full potential. But, it isn't that simple for Will and he has to learn to follow his heart and what he thinks is best for him. This screenplay, written by Damon and Affleck was nominated and won an Academy Award, as well as a Golden Globe, for "Best Writing, Screenplay Written Directly for the Screen".
 Just by looking at the cast, you can tell that the acting is going to be top-notch. Every role in this movie was cast perfectly and the actors performances were always in-character. The chemistry between Minnie Driver (Skylar) and Matt Damon (Will) is undeniable. Even though Damon wasn't yet a big-named actor, his performance was powerful. Skylar and Will's interactions were effortless, making the audience root for them without the writers needing to keep all the focus on them throughout the movie. No one could play the role of Sean better than Robin Williams. The dialogue that he delivered in the Boston Public Garden became so famous and resonated with so many that, when he passed, the bench where he delivered it became a memorial for him. Robin Williams won an Academy Award for "Best Actor in a Supporting Role" for his wonderful performance as Will's therapist/mentor, Sean. The performances were incredibly powerful and believable, and definitely one of the biggest reasons why this movie was so successful and is so loved.
 Despite the frequent use of vulgar language and the predictability of the overarching plot, "Good Will Hunting" is still definitely worth a watch. Although the opening minutes of the movie are slow, the movie as a whole presents a refreshingly enjoyable story of a mathematical genius who is, unexpectedly, relatable as he struggles with the psychological trauma from his past as well as the task of finding his true purpose in life.

Author: 10 March 2018
Review_Url: This is a 2 hr movie which i wish was a little longer. For me it can be divided into two tracks, the main protagonist's Will Hunting (Matt Damon) track and Sean Maguire (Robin Williams) track. If I had to rate the Robin Williams part I would give it 11/10, it was perfect, his Back-story , dialogs with Will Hunting,looks, acting...the best i have seen in a Hollywood drama. I could feel his love ,pain & anguish and his desperation to give Will Hunting's life a meaningful direction.

Review_Url: First word for this film is powerful, but that alone is not enough to describe the feelings i have after watching it.

Author: 20 June 2007
Review_Url: Everyone has heard about this movie, especially people from Academia. This was one of the first, well-made, and popular portrayals of the life of a mathematician. It nicely portrays how genius is delicate, and requires tender affection in order to be nurtured. The contrast between the callous mathematician and the emotional psychologist displays a theme that is relevant even today. However, this movie comes with its flaws. The love story seems a bit forced, and the lover of the main character seems one dimensional. However, Robin Williams and Matt Damon are phenomenal in their respective roles, uttering lines that will be remembered by generations to come.

Author: 17 November 2022
Review: A beautiful movie with its flaws
Review_Url:
One of the reason why i watch old movies is to find relics like this movie. A thoughtful, relatable, unbiased to someone who will watch them. It's not a love story, comedy, or tragedy. It's not heartbreaking, but it will make you cry, the reason being all the people you can be sentimental with don't have to stay, but you don't have to be alone either and meet new people along the way. 
And RIP Robin Williams, great performance there.

Author: 28 December 1998
Review: the most boring movie i have ever seen
Review_Url: After reading some of the previous comments made by viewers on this site, I get the impression some people believe a group of 21 year old guys who go to bars and drink and fight is not realistic. I would suggest they try spending a night in bar and come back to reality. Even beyond realism, this is just a flat-out great movie.

Author: 29 November 1999
Review: One of the best 5 movies of the year.
Review_Url: The dialogue in this movie is riveting because it gives you a feeling of a chess game of wits and rhetoric, set in modern times. I agree with others who've said that the movie's draw is that basically it's a well-written essay on the extent of the power of the intellect. Will Hunting at first seems like an omniscient god, but the question keeps coming up: so why is he a janitor? The answer is that no matter how much you know, you cannot go anywhere without trusting other people. You can't find love all by yourself; you have to have faith on someone to return it. Will's problem is similar to being rejected by girls over and over again: the hurt/pain tells you it's not worth it and fate will let you down anyway. Anyway Will thinks that by not trying to take his life anywhere, he's playing it safe. The thing is, he's right in that it is the safest, most controllable thing to do. He should see, however, that it is possible for people other than his childhood buddies to love him unconditionally. He refuses to see it, until Sean without asking or warning simply shows love. He didn't ask for it but he got it anyway. That is how you move a genius.

Author: 3 February 2004
Review_Url: I really must recommend this film, I had seen it once before on TV but I had been staying up way to late many nights leading up to the film and fell asleep :(..

Author: 5 January 2022
Review_Url: Not the generic type of chic flick you would expect based on other reviews I have read. It's a very nice catching story about a guy who works as a janitor in my favorite city of Boston's MIT. He appears to be a genius in science which is discovered by an intelligent professor. He tries to guide and let Will bloom with the talents he has, along with the assistance of another professor and shrink Sean (Robin Williams), who has some problems of his own. The scenery of the movie in my view is simple and not diverse, but the story of the movie is so strong it is not a problem at all, it will keep you tight to the screen for the duration of the movie.

Author: 1 March 2014
Review: Would Prefer " Lars And The Real Girl " But Not Bad At All :)
Review_Url: Before i saw "Good Will Hunting' in the cinema i was hearing about a new talent called Matt Damon who starred and wrote one of the best pictures of 1997. But it was until i saw it that i aggred with all this comments. Good Will Hunting has one of the most original screenplays of the last decade and it's not surprising the fact that its fans are mostly young people. It deals with a very serious matter and manages to examine its every aspect. It's a fresh and original movie, the kind of those we want to see more in the cinemas. Matt Damon is of course the core and the soul of this picture. He co-wrote the screenplay with Ben Affleck and managed to persuade the 'big-bosses" to make it a great movie. Demon is excellent in the lead and truly deserved the Oscar as his portrayal of Will was utterly realistic.

Author: 3 December 1998

The direction was good, acting was great by legendary actor Robin Williams, and features one of the most beautiful songs from one of my fav Elliott Smith, I wish I could have given rated it more just cause of Elliott but no this movie doesn't deserve even a 5 rating, its completely unrealistic, idk why people don't understand, why the people can't get it in their head that things in real life don't work out this way , main character is one of my most hated character ever,becoming a genius was acceptable but the type of arrogant he remains and yeah ofc the greatest thing of all time which he did at the end just justifies its only for those romantic fantasy believers out there.

Review_Url: I suppose everyone on the earth must watch this movie.

Author: 10 May 2020
Review: World needs to watch this movie
Review_Url: Yes, the end of GWH is a storybook ending, yet I'd wager that there are few who wanted it to end differently.  But that's not what I thought the movie was pushing to.  The middle part is the best stuff of the movie.  The little moments, the sandwich welfare, the world series game, the piano part, Will's self-defense in the courtroom, the list goes on and on.  These moments in the film is what makes it great.  These are the moments that allow the audience to glimpse what goes on in these character's minds.  Although there's no dialogue when Chuckie goes to Will's house near the end of the film, everyone knows what is going through his mind.  The ending isn't the most important part; the fact that he got there and how he did it is the point of the show.

Author: 31 October 1998
Review: The journey's just as important as the destination.
Review_Url: I first watched Good Will Hunting when I was 15, and didn't really fully appreciate how amazing the movie is. After watching it a second time, three years later, I can see this movie for what is is: a masterpiece. This movie will make you laugh, smile, cry. You cherish Robin Williams' and Matt Damon's relationship, as they both come to the realization that even though Williams is Damon's therapist, they equally both need each other. This movie is 100% a 10/10!

Author: 4 November 2018
Review: One of the most moving movies there is
Review_Url: I kept rewinding the part in the credits where it said that the movie was written by Ben Affleck. And then I kept looking at the DVD box that said that he won an award for it as well. Never really liked him as an actor, but I guess he has some strength in writing.

Author: 16 July 2009
Review: Your average day reality-hits-you movie, except better...
Review_Url: This is one of my favourite movies, in the same category as Kevin Smith's CHASING AMY.  The story is great, backed up by a really great script.

Author: 2 February 2004
Review: Good Movie, Williams does a great job.
Review_Url: I've seen this six or seven times over the years, and it never disappoints. You can't help but love the concept, appreciate the writing and enjoy the acting. Who wouldn't want to be Will Hunting?

Author: 3 September 2020
Review: Fantastic movie, from concept to writing to acting.
Review_Url: I love this movie for its depth of insight into human relationships. I am amazed that two young men could write this film. Yes, I could do without the continual bombardment of foul language, but I believe it to be honest to who the characters are. I am saddened to read comments from other viewers who seemed to have completely missed the point. And for those folks who pointed out in the "Goofs" listings all the math errors they could find, put down your slide rules and calculators and notice the people in the film! It's a shame this movie came out the same year as "Titanic," because it deserves Best Picture. I bought this video because its message touched me deeply.

Author: 20 January 1999
Review_Url: I actually did enjoy this movie very much although it was a bit slow. I was intrigued by the character, Will Hunting which was well played by Matt Damon. I wanted to find out why he was a troublemaker, why he was scared and every other thing. It was just a good film with a good storyline and an interesting ending.

Author: 25 August 2012
Review_Url: After seeing the remake of Hitchcock's masterpiece 'Psycho' I didn't know if I would ever watch a Gus van Sant movie again. But at a rainy Thursday night there was nothing on TV except Good Will Hunting. Hearing some people say how good this movie was made me want to give it a chance. So I did. Thirst I must that the acting is pretty decent here, even Ben Affleck (who I normally can't stand) seems to know what he is doing here. Robin Williams gives a marvelous performance and so does Matt Damon. I already knew how talented Matt Damon was when I saw him in Rounders and the Bourne Identity, but I think this was his best performance I have seen so far. The dialogue of the movie is superbly written. Some of the sentences really make sense and go deep. The story isn't bad and the character development is also very good. The direction is fair enough although I didn't really pay attention to that. Maybe I even overlook the 'Psycho' remake incident. No not really!!!!!!

Author: 6 January 2005
Review: terrific job from Matt Damon and Robin Williams
Review_Url: Not only is the premise very interesting, but Gus Van Sant's use of lighting in this movie is incredible. The screenplay is superb (it won best original screenplay ), and the acting is awesome. I have seen this movie at least 15 times and I love it more every time.

Author: 14 October 2006
Review_Url: I saw this movie only recently, years after it was first released.

Author: 27 January 2008
Review: How to know right from wrong?
Review_Url: First I want to say that I thought the movie was quite good, in fact I gave it a 7. Why only a 7? Well I judge by the standards of movies I have seen and I travel a lot. Its not really as fantastic as 'Unbearable Lightness of Being' or 'Moscow does not believe in tears', but that is the price we pay for living in a society where Hollywood hype dictates what people go and see. Audiences rave about the sizzle and not the steak, which I feel is the case with many reviews here. Not only this film.

Author: 1 August 2005

Author: 26 October 2005
Review_Url: Slight Spoiler!

Author: 10 July 2006
Review: One must be pretty sharp to think about this movie.
Review_Url: I can confidently say this will be my favorite movie for the rest of my life. The storyline is unique, inspiring, and penetrating. The authenticity of every performance is as good as it gets, especially from Matt Damon, Robin Williams, Ben Affleck, and Minnie Driver. There are so many nuggets I circle back to time and again throughout the course of my days. I especially love the "club a baby seal" scene and the "ya suspect!" scenes. I point at my husband and yell "ya suspect - - ya you!!" at least 5 times a day. I'll never forget Sean's (Robin William's) wise words about not really arriving at a place of true wisdom until you know what it smells like in the Sistine Chapel. Until then you're just (wicked) 'smaat' and spouting out facts you've memorized from books you've checked out at the public library. I think it is such a beautiful coming of age story and it stays with, and matures with, the viewer in every season of his/her life. I can't think of another movie that has been so refreshingly authentic, so chalked full of perfect one-liners, so genuinely reflective of what it means to be a student of academia and the real world, and so powerfully representative of the magnitude of having someone just believe in you.

Author: 4 May 2020
Review_Url: This is one of the better movies I have seen in a long time.  The movie holds your attention the entire time.  It also shows that good guys don't have to finish last.  The only problem I see is that the language could have been cleaned up.  I don't understand why that can't be left out of great movies so everyone can enjoy them.

Author: 14 December 1998
Review_Url: A great inspirational message about fulfilling your purpose and not settling for mediocrity. Very emotional and intense. I can always watch this movie and be interested.

Author: 15 October 2021
Review_Url: I've seen this movie seven times already, and each time I like it better. It is also the only movie thusfar that has brought tears to my eyes and left me unable to make some kind of wise-crack to release the emotional tension (the moment Will Hunting breaks up). Everything about this movie is brilliant: the photography, the acting (what a performance by the ever so irritating Robin Williams, whom I forgive all the Flubber, Jumanji and Robin Hood-crap for this flick), the story, the dialogue, the music.

Author: 21 February 2002
Review: young, rebellious intelligent guy comes to grip
Review_Url: The Good

Author: 15 August 2014
Review_Url: On a shoe-string budget, with a less than well-known cast, Good Will Hunting once again proves you don't have to spend a lot of money in Hollywood to produce a first rate movie with a first rate ensemble cast.  Matt Damon (Will Hunting) and Ben Afleck are buddies who wrote the Oscar winning screenplay together.  Damon also garnered a well-deserved Best Actor Oscar nomination. Minnie Driver (As Will's girlfriend Skylar) and Robin Williams (as Will's counselor Sean Maguire) were also nominated as Best Supporting Actress and Best Supporting Actor respectively.  Both are superb in their supporting roles.

Author: 29 September 1998
Review: ...Good Will Hunting is a diamond in the rough
Review_Url: In case you haven't seen Good Will Hunting (it's OK...I hadn't seen it until 3 weeks ago), it tells the story of a poor Bostonian young man named Will, played by Matt Damon, who has had an incredibly turbulent life and whose social status prevents him from achieving something. Though Will is brilliant and should be attending a school like MIT, he mops its floors instead. After getting into some trouble with the law, a MIT professor who needs Will's help to solve a perplexing mathematical equation takes the young man under his wing and helps Will receive a lighter sentence, providing he goes to a therapist. After seeing many shrinks, Will finally meets with Sean, played by Robin Williams, who eventually guides and befriends the reluctant Will.

Author: 30 November 2005
Review_Url: The winner of Project Greenlight, "Good Will Hunting" to me deserved to win every award that there was giving in 1997. Matt Damon and Ben Affleck did an amazing job depicting the want to be good enough to move on with "will" a metaphor established for the main character "Will" as he journeys from his innermost want to a real goal in society. The story journeys with Will as he battles his own demons for a chance to express himself in smarts. The movie explores the differences in classes in society in Boston but really stood as a metaphor not just for that difference in society, but of gender, status and affiliation as well. Themes that came up were "boys will be boys", "I am the King of my own mansion", "where there's 'will', there's a way" and "dreams, they do come true".

Author: 16 June 2015
Review_Url: It didn't have bombs.  It didn't have comets.  And it didn't have a gigantic, sinking boat.  Bottom line?  Didn't need it.  In this inspiring, fantasy-wrought screenplay brought to life, Ben Affleck and Matt Damon prove that a down-to-earth, low-budget film can capture magnificence without all the special effects and larger than life cinematography.  With Gus Van Sant, the envisioner of the movie, and the unsurprisingly superb Danny Elfman behind the musical wheel, Good Will Hunting deserved the Oscar for Best Picture.  Titanic was predictable and true; Good Will Hunting offered a new story to the genre of fantasy screenplays, and it was evident in its winning Best Original Screenplay.  As deserving as this was, the Academy fell far short of a consolation prize when it denied it Best Picture.  See this movie and follow along with Will on his magical "hunt" for a future and security.

Author: 4 March 2001
Review: An injection of motivation and spine-tingling inspiration.
Review_Url: This movie is a very weird story about a smart cleaning man whose obsession with telling apple jokes threatens to ruin his having a happy life with his muscle bound secret genie therapist played by that Robot Williams guy.

Author: 4 January 2022
Review: More like "a@&hole Will never goes hunting and sucks"
Review_Url: Good Will Hunting is a film filled with charisma, and realness. What I mean by this is it plays with the theme of wasted potential or the getting out of mentality. Will Hunting represents an un tapped potential that when nurtured becomes the next big thing but in the end it is not what he seeks Will just wants to be human and live life. This take on the wasted potential mentality is an unpopular one that has not been tapped before this film aired. Chuckie Sullivan is real. We all know a Chuck. Chuckie represents the realness of bitter life but also hope and comfort. Which represents the getting out mentality in it's most common form.

Author: 29 March 2023
Review_Url: i found it really overrated, i mean the movie was very slow & felt like they were stretching the scenes, they could have used the concept a lot better but, i think in the old times this was the kind of movies people liked, but today us the new generation will find it extremely boring. so to sum it up, if you are born after 2000 you won't like it. i am sorry if it hurts

Author: 24 October 2017
Review_Url: I really liked this movie and i would recommend it to anyone who wants to watch something. Matt Damon, Robin Williams and Mini Driver give there best acting performances i have ever seen, an unique plot which works well and has a good ending.

Author: 21 May 2003
Review_Url: This movie changed my life. Best Robin Williams Movie.

Author: 5 May 2020
Review_Url: Despite being named one of the most over rated films of all time by many, "Good Will Hunting" is a different, brave film that presents uncomfortable topics rarely spoken about by men including dreams and emotions. While the story itself is solid it is really brought together by incredible performances by the young Matt Damon, Robin Williams and almost every other actor. While it may not be perfect it most certainly is timeless and well worth the watch if you have 2 hours of concentration in you.

Author: 18 June 2021
Review_Url: Good Will Hunting is about inspiration. Its about the "good" before "will hunting" which says every man is good, and he has got his history, and its all about bringing that "good" from a human being. Its about the connection between teacher and student, doctor and patient, father and son. 10/10.

Author: 30 December 2007
Review_Url: This might be Robin Williams' best role. His arc and Matt Damon's arc are beautiful to watch. An epic drama with realistic depictions of relationships. I could go on and on. Watch this movie!

Author: 16 April 2022
Review_Url:
The dialogues were so incredible that I can't recall so many films with dialogues this much great! Specially the ones between Sean and Will! Seriousness, beauty, laugh and many good staff you wanna see and here are there for you in their dialogues.
Guess it deserved the best screenplay of the year

Author: 25 March 2019
Review_Url: Directed by Gus Van Sant, Good Will Hunting is the story of a mathematical genius named Will Hunting, played by Matt Damon. The film takes place in the campus at MIT, where Hunting works as a janitor. One day after his class is over, mathematics Professor Lambeau writes a problem on the board that took several MIT professors two years to figure out, and challenges his students to solve it. When Hunting sees the problem, he solves it by himself in a matter of minutes. The movie then unravels the genius in him, but also portrays his many weaknesses and his rough childhood.

Author: 5 July 2015
Review_Url: If something is really call perfection that is that movie. A beautiful story line , beautiful acting , beautiful direction and a massage the real meaning off happiness which not come by money or repution it come by love.

Author: 16 March 2019
Review_Url: The movie felt like a story about myself, And I can say that, many people will feel it as their own story. The bad experiences of past holds us to be free. The regreats makes the life worse. The movie is about living free, living life without regreats. It will surely compell you to ask questions about "The Why" behind your present.

Author: 17 May 2020
Review_Url: This movie is certainly one of the greatest I have seen in a long time.  The screenplay, in particular, was nothing short of brilliant, and its Oscar was well-deserved.  Robin Williams' performance as Sean Maguire was realistic and thoughtful, as was Matt Damon's performance as Will.  I am being truthful when I say that I laughed and cried at this movie, and I don't often cry at movies.

Author: 29 August 1999
Review_Url: The fact that this film was nominated for Best Picture makes me sick to my stomach. The fact that this film was nominated for anything makes me sick. Every award this film was nominated for should have been a nomination for The Ice Storm instead. The Ice Strom was interesting and touching on so many levels and it was filled with brilliant performances. This film interested me in only one way; why the hell did so many people like it?

Author: 25 July 1999
Review_Url: Here are Matt Damon, Minnie Driver, and Robin Williams in top form. Sometimes riveting, sometimes funny, sometimes heartbreaking, sometimes all three.  I've seen this four times, and it *still* gets me.

Author: 2 January 2000
Review_Url: This movie is very touching.There are a lot of very impressive dialogues especially the one when Sean and Will talked together in the park and the one where Will explained why he shouldn't work for the NSA.

Author: 9 August 1998
Review_Url: The film works because it manages to capture various shades of each character in an unforced manner through an intelligent script.Though the impossibility of the scenario depicted may make one apprehensive in the beginning,it is precisely that which allows the cast the unique opportunity to lend credibility to the film's script by their remarkably honest performances complemented by crackling dialogue which ranges from the witty,to the profound,to the meaningfully terse without being overly emphatic at any time.There are many things which have been handled with admirable sensitivity like the bond of friendship between the boys,how the healer(Sean)manages to reach out to Will who in turn makes an impact on him,the refreshing chemistry between Will and Skylar,how prof.Lambeau's personal fears,Will's troubled past and his vulnerability are brought out.Yet for all it's finer nuances,the story is told in such a simple and lucid manner that it holds one's attention even if one refuses to probe into them.I can go on and on about this layered film but i'd rather not because i would like the reader to watch this engaging film speak it's own language himself(or herself)and gather the joys of discovering it's subtleties.

Author: 26 December 2007
Review_Url: Matt Damon and Ben Affleck make an enormously perfect debut with their screenplay. Truly written from the heart, GHW is one of the best movies ever written and unquestionably the best date/romance movie ever! The entire cast is phenomenal, there is nothing negative to be said about this movie. Movies like this are few and far between (this and L.A. Confidential were my picks for 1998' Best Pic.....too bad Titanic was in the same year)This is a movie that shows you don't need top-name stars and a million special effects to make a great movie that also packs an emotional wallop. Yeah, the ending is a little weak, but the rest of the movie makes up for it. If you haven't seen this movie yet, go out and rent it, I guarantee you will love it. Oh, by the way, Matt Damon's performance was also 10 times better than Jack Nicholson's....'cmon, anyone can play someone with OCD but not everyone can play someone from Southie and is a genius. But Matt Damon really is from Southie and he and Ben Affleck really are geniuses.....GWH proves it.

Author: 4 July 2000
Review: Good Will sure went Hunting to get this excellent movie
Review_Url: Good Will Hunting is fantastic! A story written by Matt Damon and Ben Afleck which is a little mastermind that leaves you with a large smile at the end, after the emotional roller-coaster throughout. Will Hunting (Matt Damon) is a mathematical genius and has potential that only one wishes to have, however there is real personal issues that has affected Will, stopping his own potential to be full-filled because of his life experiences growing up as a child. In more specific terms Will is like a terrified child who stays at home on his couch, so he doesn't have to go into the real world and feel the kind of hurt that has affected him before in life. Will hangs around with so called "no brainers" and his best friend Chuckie (Played by Ben Afleck) who is the type that really would lie in the middle of the road for Will we gradually begin to admire this genuine loyal friendship that in the middle class world seems to be rare for some people. Great sub-plot with therapist Sean Maguire (played by Robin Williams) which is like cat and mouse with each meetings they have. Will has always called the shots and kept in control of what he wants people to no and understand about him, but Sean is finally his match, and with great dialogue this kept me locked and fascinated throughout the film as i generally wanted to no more about Will and understand him! There is love in Will's life called Skylar (played by Minne Driver) and Skylar has everything charisma, looks, intelligence and a very sweet/caring side. Will struggles throughout being able to allow himself to love Skylar and become vulnerable for a women once in his life. Good Will hunting is a film that educates and provokes human ignorance for roughly 2 hours and definitely changes people perceptions of judging people who they truly don't understand!

Author: 26 January 2009
Review_Url: This is one of those perfect, all-around well made films. The script was so well written there was no drawn out segments used to bridge one part of the film to another. The storyline flowed flawlessly. The cinematography was clean and maintained dramatic tone without unnecessary effects. The actors performances were outstanding Robin Williams is both believable and sympathetic in his role as a good-hearted psychologist with a sensitive past. He earned every inch of that Oscar. Matt Damon also gave a brilliant performance as the damaged genius whose quick comments and fast thinking has the audience laughing when they least expect it. The math professor was a scene stealer and it's a wonder why he hasn't appeared in more known films.

Author: 27 July 2006
Review_Url:
I was watching this movie and I felt some pain near my chest than I thought it is growing pain
It means that my mind was growing like I grow up
This movie help my mind grow.

Author: 25 September 2021
Review: what's this pain that I felt near my chest
Review_Url: This movie is definitely one of my favorites. I gave it an eight, but I really would like to give it an eight and a half. It deserved it. The acting is superb, and there aren't really any major blemishes in the film. This is a movie that almost anyone can enjoy. All ages should appreciate this film for what it is; a triumph. Really, this movie has it all, humor, drama, intensity, and romance. I suggest you rent this on DVD, because it contains around 9 gigabytes of info on it, which translates into a lot of extras.

Author: 24 February 2002
Review: It deserved the recognition it received
Review_Url: On any given day, I probably would have spent my evening reading, or playing video games, or watching TV. Today, however, I decided to log onto Netflix and see what was available to "Watch Instantly." I looked under the "Recommended for You" section and saw the title of a film I had only ever heard of. I had never bothered to ask anyone what it was about; my parents had told me a while ago that it was a great movie, but naturally I hadn't listened (after all, it was rated R). I couldn't even make out the actors on the tiny image of the DVD box. All I recognized was the title: Good Will Hunting. I was done with my homework, I didn't have anything constructive to do, and I was bored, so I clicked on the link that read, "Play Movie". I'm glad I did.

Author: 9 February 2011
Review_Url: I've seen the movie for the first time a few weeks ago. Curious about other people's opinion, I took a look on film's comments. Some people gave this film a very low rating. It's obvious why. If those people know the life from watching movies and TV shows, this movie means nothing. But if you go out there, living between real people on a daily basis, you realise the qualities of this film. Comparing it with another Hollywood movie, this film is crap. Comparing it with the real life, it is unbelievable true and exciting. If we analyse the qualities of a film by the amount of truth brought in from our day-by-day life, of course, if we really want to see life and not only ourselves every single moment, we realise how mach frustration can be hidden in an individual.

Author: 15 June 2003
Review_Url: This movie is not as overrated ,and the plot as bad as some people claim. The plot is understandable, and the character is somewhat deep. The serious scenes are acted out pretty well. The end makes sense. All that being said, this movie does not live up to its "Oscar-Winning" hype. The start of the movie , first, kinda doesn't make any sense.If Will Hunting was so smart, how come it took him until now for someone to spot his jewel. It just doesn't make sense. The plot, however decent and understandable, doesn't seem to segue smoothly. For example, there is a scene where the professor and the therapist are arguing. Then, when Will comes in and they kiss and make up. Where in the hell did that come from? Finally, there is the ending, which is the worst part. It leaves us hanging, with no clues whatsoever as to the outcome of his trip to Cali. I am probably making this film out worse than it actually is. The movie itself is worth a good watch. Not the greatest, though.

Author: 10 June 2013
Review_Url: No matter what you like, you're guaranteed to find it in this movie.  It will make you laugh, make you cry, and make you think.  I highly recommend it to anyone.

Author: 20 March 1999
Review_Url: To start off, I would highly recommend this to any viewers 16 and older who are mature enough to understand the beauty of the film. This Oscar award winning film so full of emotion you feel as if you are right in the story feeling what Will feels. When Will proves the equation on the board, the momentum begins to pick up. Soon after proving he is a genius, he shows that he is also a brute, and a lover. He can take on hooligans as well as keep a girlfriend. The movie shows how Will and Mr Lambeau begin to connect through their mathematical triumph, but the professors spot in the boys heart quickly fades as he meets a therapist he cannot best. Robin Williams plays Sean Maguire, a run down psychologist working at a community college. He teaches Will many lessons through the pain of his wife's death. He explains how his brain does not allow him to comprehend true emotional responses in situation, he knows them, but does not feel them. The movie is really all about the transformation of this Albert Einstein boy played by Matt Damon from a bum to a functioning member of society. The actors play their roles perfectly and are made for these roles. This movie allows us to see parts of ourselves reflected in Will, and almost brings you to tears when Will breaks down. Flawless movie except for all the cursing to make it R seemed very unnecessary and out of context, otherwise beautiful execution.

Author: 2 May 2016
Review: Fantastic Movie, Great Plot, Great Actors
Review_Url: The script of this film is of course easy to be in awe of as it won it's Oscar, deservedly so, and showered movie critics with something to obsess over. So I'm going to hop on the bandwagon and share my thoughts

Author: 30 December 2017
Review: Superb Script-Writing and Brilliant Cast Support
Review_Url: I saw this movie 2 years ago so maybe I'm not in the right position to write about it. Truth is I remember a few things about what happened in this film. The story didn't work right for me. I felt like I was watching another film with Robin Williams who was playing the same role over and over again. For another time Williams was playing the good man of the story. Sure he did an excellent performance but its unfortunate that we didn't see this actor play a wide variety of roles before leaving this world for good. Mat Damon is an actor who I can't go along with him in almost any movie he ever played. Same goes with Ben Affleck. Their performances were ok for me but not Oscaw worthy. Same goes with the screenplay. Gus Van Sant did an alright work but nothing out of the ordinary at least for today. I don't know maybe this movie was a success because of it's time but nowadays it seems obsolete. Yes it has good dialogue and some awesome quotes and the ending is leaving you with a bittersweet taste in your mouth but I myself couldn't delve into the film's world. Now you can find a million of movies like this one. I know that it's a movie that inspired almost every other movie of this genre but still I can't consider it a masterpiece. A good movie but nothing out of the ordinary at least for me.

Author: 27 February 2018
Review_Url: This movie is in my top 5 possibly even top 3 because one people can relate to the story. Two the acting is initiated well. good flow maybe a little bit slow in the beginning but totally worth watching through! I hands down recommend this movie :)

Author: 22 March 2019
Review: By far one of my top 5 movies to date!!!
Review_Url: I rented this movie not expecting it to live up to hype. I had not heard one person say a bad word about this film and they were absolutely right. Damon's character is complex and involving, sometimes even quite humorous. The on screen chemistry between him and Affleck is a joy to watch, Affleck being far less intelligent than Damon's character yet having more common sense and seeing that Will Hunting was just wasting himself is an interesting angle.

Author: 12 February 1999
Review_Url: 1- It's a movie, you don't believe the plot lines? Welcome to Hollywood. For example: Do you think 8 guys would cross Europe & find Private Ryan? Of course not, but you've got to buy the basic premise folks. ANYTHING can and does happen IRL, why not this? (who cares if it is a Math Genius or a Stud athlete - hell both are rare, but how many 'sports stud' movie characters do we automatically accept?)

Author: 9 June 2006
Review_Url: Good Will Hunting gets a 10 out of 10. Very powerful and emotional film.

Author: 30 March 2007
Review_Url: Good Will Hunting, the story of 4 Irish-Catholic boys in Boston circles around the relationship between them and in particular Will Hunting himself. A boy genius that has a troubled background, Will begins counseling with Sean, portrayed in one of the best performances of a generation by Robin Williams. They discuss many things about Will and his life. What will he do with it? Where will he go? All the while, Will is building a romantic involvement with a young college woman named Skylar. The choice in the end comes down to siding to change the world with his genius or to go to California and chase the woman of his dreams. Throughout these tough decisions Will learns about himself, life, and what is truly important in this word. Sometimes money is to some, sometimes love, sometimes neither. Will has options and has choices and this story uplifts the viewer to appreciate the little things in life and understand the complexity of a boy trying to find himself, like most do at that point in their lives.

Author: 17 March 2009
Review_Url: Hands down one of my favorite movies of all times. The intelligent writing from Matt and Ben makes this a classic and must have for any library.

Author: 23 January 2013
Review: One of the best Independent Films of all time
Review_Url: What a cliche! Poor and genius boy is noticed by a rich man, but poor boy is proud because of things that are in his past and denies the modern world and the richness. But then magical things happen. Our genius but poor boy turns a winner. Then he thanks everybody for his great life. THE END.

Author: 13 April 2021
Review_Url: I love this movie and I love how it writes itself into existence. The opening dialogue and the characters and how they interact with each other. There is a magic about it that really hits home. Like applying to get into school for example. Building the careers of two writers as a boon to the industry for itself. The fun the film shows and the sadness of being human. But the joy comes after the sadness and the build it is really spectacular. This is a film class in it of itself of being both entertaining and beautiful. The work that went into deserves praise as well as the acting. Robin Williams...

Author: 25 May 2023
Review_Url: One of my all time favourite films, 'Good Will Hunting' portrays the trials and tribulations of a 20-something genius fighting to reconcile his talent and his lifestyle. Matt Damon is superb as the fresh-faced, insecure Will Hunting, and displays a striking sense of vulnerability beneath a rough, uncompromising exterior, particularly in the psychiatry scenes...which brings me to Robin Williams. Whilst I have occasionally thought that Williams can tend towards the cloyingly sentimental, his performance here as Will's psychiatrist is truly towering, which was acknowledged by a 'best supporting' Oscar. Peter Sasgaard (think that's how you spell it!) is also worth a mention, with an excellent performance an unlikable, but ultimately well-intentioned professor. Minnie Driver also stars in a nicely portrayed, if somewhat limited role.

Author: 13 December 2005
Review_Url: A timeless classic, surely brilliant and one of the first movies I have ever watched where I wanted to be the main character. Will's impeccable ability to calculate with his amazing mathematical abilities is the ticket he's sitting on and not cashing in. Will not being in his slightest interest of math is so comparable with how realistic people are today. Will's perceptions from his friends, and shrink have him going where his heart desires all along.

Author: 24 February 2016
Review: A movie I will continue to look back at and gain a new found wisdom and lesson
Review_Url: Good Will Hunting is a movie about Will Hunting, a misunderstood poor boy from South Boston, who has a genius-level IQ and works as a janitor at a university. He solves a near-impossible math problem that takes professionals years to master, and is given the offer to be one of the smartest mathematicians ever, but after getting in a fight with a police officer, he is sent to Dr. Sean Maguire to have therapy sessions. What starts as a reluctant bonding session turns into a budding friendship that changes his world.

Author: 9 July 2016
Review: A Great Movie that Should be Watched by Everyone.
Review_Url: This is one of those movies that whenever I see it on the guide I have to watch it. Robin Williams and Matt Damon are magic together on the screen and it makes me wish that they had collaborated on more films. Good Will Hunting has stood the test of time and I truly believe this movie is a MUST SEE for everyone.

Author: 20 April 2020
Review: A timeless movie that I can watch over and over again
Review_Url: This film is mindblowing, the script is jaw droping and most definitely deserved the oscar, the story is simply jaw droping and is an excellent instalment of classic cinema. Easily one of Damons most compelling persormance yet, but I do think Afflecks performance is just as good and that he doesn't get given enough credit.

Author: 8 November 2019
Review: One of the best films ever made.
Review_Url: "If you wish others to believe in you, you must first convince them that you believe in them".....a quote which is apt for describing the soul of the movie.... The movie surprises me every time i see it with the sheer depth of the story and strength in each of the characters... it is probably the most defining role of Robin Williams after patch adams and his portrayal of sean is stunning... Matt Damon playing the bad-boy-genius with the fragile mix of lightheartedness and hidden sadness is worth watching and his role is quite beautifully supported by his buddies portrayed by the afflecks and Cole Hauser and also Damon's love interest Skylar (minnie driver)....

Author: 10 May 2008
Review_Url:
But this movie is damn close to perfection.
the story is great, the cast extremely good and the way they filmed is is fantastic.

Author: 8 November 2018
Review_Url: This movie made me think about things I never thought about before. I'd like to write more but I gotta go see about a girl. Here's the lyrics to my favourite song instead.

Author: 8 January 2023
Review_Url: this is one of the movies which has inspired me deeply. In some way or the other way this movie depicts the life of people who because of their repression defense mechanism are not able to achieve what they ought to achieve if they haven't repressed their abilities and i was instantly able to attach myself with the character of will hunting as i have myself repressed my abilities so as to run away from people's eyes. But after watching this movie i am deeply enthralled and also motivated to fight inner demons of fear in me and to emerge as a person i am and which i am ought to be .Thanks for Ben Affleck and Matt Damon to bring such a script which is so touching and a path finder for people who are making their abilities go redundant just because of some stupid psychological problem

Author: 2 December 2009
Review_Url: I can't believe how black and white the reviews on here are for this film. People either seem to think it perfect, or terrible. I have neither of these views - it was however a very good film. Not in my top 10, but certainly in the top 100.

Author: 22 January 2012
Review: Subtle and beautiful in most ways, unbelievable in others.
Review_Url: I am a Medalist of the International Math Olympiad and this was boring.

Author: 7 November 2020
Review: I am a Medalist of the International Math Olympiad and this was boring.
Review_Url: Although not a family movie, this is one of the greatest flicks in modern times.  Don't look for big special effects, a big soundtrack, or a historical backdrop.  This is a gritty film that is well written and well made.  To me, Matt Damon will always be Will and Ben Affleck will always be Chuck and this will always be their best roles.  That is not to undercut the great performances of Casey Affleck and Cole Hauser.  The classic lines that come from this movie will live on forever with some of its true fans. Robin Williams does a fine job in one of his more low key performances.  Other supporting cast members also stand out.  Once you see this movie, you will either love it or hate, but you will come away with a few (if not more) memorable, well-written, well-acted scenes.  For the well-rounded movie viewer, it is a must!

Author: 12 May 2001
Review_Url: Will reaches a breakthrough in therapy where he finally accepts that his parents' death wasn't his fault and he is therefore able to love himself for the first time.

Author: 10 March 2020
Review_Url: Now it is very rare that I give a film 10/10 because I believe that no film can be 'perfect' - but for the first time I believe I have found a genuine 10.

Author: 13 July 2012
Review_Url: I started watching this movie thinking that it was a classic movie that everyone should watch at least once. I also had high expectations because of the actors. Perhaps if I watched it without all this preconception, I would have given more than 2/10, but it was a huge disappointment for me. The plot was incredibly predictable, the dialogues were cringeworthy and one cannot avoid to think that this movie is only such a big hype because of the famous/good looking actors. What was so interesting about the love-interest of Will that was worth giving up a good job opportunity and literally all the people that actually cared about him? And the scene with "it's not your fault", it was just so hard to watch.

Author: 1 May 2023
Review_Url: Matt Damon and Ben Affleck deserve a lot of credit for this movie.  One reason they painted such an excellent portrayal of life as it really is or could be, may be attributed to their youth.  Youth facilitated this film with universal themes of the transformation from youth to adult, and to balance the rebelling nature of Will Hunting, Robin Williams adds (with a very well developed character) the humbled but wiser soul of an older man. Even though Will being so naturally gifted at math seems a little out of the ordinary, it is supposed to be this way. The movie takes this abnormality and uses it to make everyone realize how much like Will they are.  Math may not be your strong point or your weak point either, but this characteristic of Will is simply an example of a trait that could cause any type of tension or problems in the life of a person.  I especially love how Williams' character is written into this same theme so that personalities young and old clash. This is one of few movies that can truly move me emotionally every time I see it, and it is because it can be related to every human that ever lived.

Author: 20 April 2003
Review: A great amount of respect for this simple, yet profound work
Review_Url: It appears the jury is hung... many people either loved or hated this movie. I can tell you why I loved it. First of all the script. I think it had a real slice of life, and brilliance in it. Sorry, but some people do use 4 letter words to express themselves. And no, it doesn't mean that's because they lack intelligence to use anything else. I can rise to the occasion any time I need w/out profanity. But it is how I think & speak in my day to day life. The language shouldn't even be an issue. If that's all you heard, you weren't listening! The brilliance in it is everywhere. For example, William's character putting Damon's character in place by noting that he sneers at things that he has no real life experience with. I know people like that. Then moments when he (William's character) says gems like, "I'll save you the suspense sport- she isn't perfect & neither are you- the question is whether you are perfect for each other." I'm paraphrasing of course. The question of relationships, and life career decisions- the courage to risk and overcoming whatever your background is, are all a part of real life. This isn't supposed to be about genius or some "white trash" as someone else said (some people might say the kids in this movie aren't trash, just normal hard working, middle class guys) - it's about love, life and courage- courage to ante up & try again, no matter how many times life knocks us around. The acting, direction and script are wonderful. They definitely deserved the Oscar for this. It has soul. It has meaning & I am sad for the people that didn't get it. As the movie "American Beauty" said... LOOK CLOSER.

Author: 31 January 2012
Review_Url: This is the best movie I have seen since the Godfather. Matt Damon and Ben Affleck make a great team...not only as actors, but more impressively as co-writers. Add Robin Williams in perhaps his best role ever (too close to Good Morning Vietnam for me to make the call), and you have a wonderfully entertaining movie.

Author: 7 August 2017
Review_Url: I've noticed that this movie has received some harsh criticism.  First of all, if you watch the movie and pay any attention, you can see that the story does make sense, and the casting works (I don't think they ever mentioned anything about an Irish gang).  Is the story believable?  Maybe. But the writing is good enough that it can get you to think, which is important.  Also, any movie that can get such strong feelings from viewers, good or bad, has made an important statement.

Author: 11 May 2004
Review_Url: Hi, i am Sam Radseresht. When i first saw this movie, i thought it was the film with the most bad language in the universe. But then, i looked at it again and again. And in the end, it practically became an obsession. I admired Robin's character Sean so much that i even wanted to be a therapist. I put books all over my room, read them, and studied hard in school. The film was truly a strong inspiration to my life, and i do want to take the opportunity to thank Robin Williams, for making his character so believable and real. Matt Damon and Ben Affleck for writing their wonderful screenplay that consisted of so many beautiful words of knowledge. Gus van Sant for making it possible and my mum for buying it a our local Virgin. So, if you wan't a movie of speech, excitement and emotion, Godd Will Hunting is the best so far. Even if you may not be a fan of Matt, Ben, Robin or any other cast members, please do watch it for they certainly deserve a big applaud.

Author: 30 April 2006
Review: Best motion picture!!!!!! Of every year
Review_Url: That one scene gets me every time, amazing performances by Matt Damon and Robin Williams, even by Will's friends, the chemistry between Damon and Affleck really shines through. Who would've thought you could learn so much about life from a film.

Author: 18 September 2021
Review_Url: I really enjoyed the originality of this film when it first came out. I liked they idea of a boy genius from Boston, Go RED SOX! I think the story was interesting and worked really well. There were a lot of little nuances, like the Dunken Donuts coffee, and the interaction between the friends that made this film great. Ben Afflec and Matt Damon had great chemistry; maybe it is because they were such close friends in real life. All the acting was really great. The accents were priceless. I'm glad that Robin Williams was finally able to get an Oscar because he is really great actor and he totally deserved it. This film made me wish I was better at math, seems very lucrative. I think this film is great because all the people seem real and their lives aren't thrilling but you really feel for the characters. I found this movie extremely entertaining and I would recommend it to anyone.

Author: 12 April 2007
Review_Url: Good Will Hunting was extremely heart-warming.  The story of a genius from the wrong side of the tracks really captures your heart.  Matt Damon was terrific in the title role, as was the rest of the cast.  This movie was truly deserving of it's Oscar nominations and, in my opinion, was better than Titanic.

Author: 31 July 1998
Review_Url: It is a wonderful film.I can't say all I want because I'm not so good in English but I want only to advise all of you to watch it because I've liked it a lot.That's all.

Author: 6 December 1998
Review_Url: Honestly just a brilliant film. Profoundly touching and hard to believe this was written by such young actors. Truly one of a kind and a joy to watch.

Author: 16 October 2020
Review_Url: In a year of the ultimate high budget film, Titanic, Good Will Hunting was at the very least a breath of fresh air.  With it's budget a miniscule fraction of the Oscar winning best picture, Gus Van Sant and the writers, Matt Damon and Ben Affleck, produced a picture with much more substance and emotion than any other movie that year. Critics have questioned the reality of this film.  Is it so hard to believe that there is a kid genius from the slums of South Boston?  As far as I'm concerned, the critics must be appalled at the idea that someone without a Harvard education could be so successful and so intelligent.  Get over this fact, and get over this part of the movie.  In all likelihood, the fact that he is a genius isn't the most important element in the film.

Author: 11 December 1999
Review_Url:
It's the first time I've ever write a film review even I feel like I really should starting to do it for such a long time.
I've heard tones of good reviews on this film but I just watched it now, when the pandemic has been on for almost half a year and people have been questioning themselves a lot recently including me. During this hard time I felt confused, lost , angry, disappointed and negative, all these emotions and feelings are the ones that I've never imagined that I would be like when I thought about it.
While I was watching it, I couldn't bear my tears at all from about 40 mins. It reminds me of all those tiny things from the past, failed relationships, people that I've missed and moments that I regret. Your struggled feelings slowly burned up with Will all the way to the climax because you understand exactly how he feels, you understand those hard journeys that make him and you who you are today, but meanwhile, you still want to see and anxious to see him makes the decision that you know what is right.
I'm having a very bittersweet feeling right now and I guess this also explains perfectly why films are so powerful, what a great script, what a character building. I love how Matt used the script shows off a bit side of his English education background with small parts like mentioning about Oliver Twist by Charles Dickens, Skyler as the British girlfriend, all little details were very nicely putted.
I just wanted to say how lucky Will is to have these people around him, his friends, met the Gerry who found his talents and cherished it so much who would do everything to keep it up, and Sean who smartly guides him all the way and also truly understands him, and of course Skyler, a lovely vivid soul with a brave, strong and beautiful heart. All character's personalities are so different and so lively, they're all just like reflections of people around us in the real life, all these lead me to the final question that, did we really cherished our life well enough? If not why don't we just start doing it now? It's never too late.

Author: 1 August 2020
Review: A master piece that will wake you up
Review_Url: Good Will Hunting is one of the most beautifully written, directed, and acted movies there has ever been. I've read the screenplay and seen the movie numerous times, and I can tell you that there has never been a more original film. My love of this film is one of the reasons that I hate Titanic so much. Good Will Hunting deserved all of the Academy Awards that it was nominated for, more even. It was one of the happiest moments of my life when I saw Matt Damon, Ben Affleck, and Robin Williams accepting their Oscars. No one has ever deserved them more. I feel sorry for Minnie Driver though. She deserved her Oscar much more than Kim Basinger did. Kim was barely in any of L.A. Confidential, while Minnie was one of the most important characters. They all deserve Oscars.

Author: 4 October 1998
Review: One of, if not the best movie ever made.
Review_Url: I love the slow build-up and character development, unfortunately the ending is just unpredictable as the chance of winning of a lottery ticket. Though I do wish for a happy ending for the main character, unfortunately this is a hanging future I have to live with, hence the less than perfect score.

Author: 10 November 2021
Review_Url: I liked Titanic, but it was a silly film when compared to Good Will Hunting. This movie was so emotional and moving.  It was still on my mind three weeks after I first saw it.  The script was original, and the acting was beyond phenomenal.  Good Will Hunting should have won the Oscar for Best Picture of 1997.

Author: 20 September 1998
